19spfBBrwy7Dpo7vZF6m2Q.text: The decor is amazing. Pawn store in the front. Cozy bar pass the hostess check in. The dishes are meant to be shared so everyone can taste everything. We had a big group so waitress did say that for smaller dishes she would put in two orders. However sometimes it wasn't necessary to double up. For example, we ordered chicken meatballs and spaghettini. She put in two orders automatically. These dishes were both ok. So one order would have been fine especially since you can cut meatballs in half. Also dishes should have been staggered out a lil more. First two dishes were staggered. And then all of the other dishes we orders came out at once. Noise level was a bit louOverall good experience.

alMWnT4_8HjbFLEPYcC1RQ.text: We had a very friendly waitress and quick service. The food was delicious! We ordered 4 plates & weren't able to finish all of them. Definitely get the grilled cheese dumplings and the Brussels sprout salad!

nF60qqOAUaoHVt_z3AISug.text: Who knew this was there!! B&E is so hidden. I don't think that I would have ever noticed it if I hadn't been talking about my upcoming trip to Vegas with some friends. They told me exactly how to find the spot.  I'm so glad I did. I came here with some coworkers.  We loved their tomato soup, the one that has the grilled cheese dumplings in it.  Some of my co workers gushed for days about their scallops, the ones with the bbq fries.  The service here was wonderful.  I ended up coming back here on my own, to have a nice drink before catching up with some other friends before we headed out to Marquee for the night. Tapas menus are wonderful and it's the perfect place to share so many things.  I really enjoyed their wedge salad too, not too huge and not too over done with dressing or other toppings. Everything was perfecto!! Beware. . . this venue is pretty tight. So, I don't know that it's the place for a big group unless you make arrangements with management somehow. I only mention that because while dining here, a large group of about 10-15 people strolled in and they almost had to consider sitting in smaller groups throughout the restaurant unless they were willing to wait for a cluster of tables to open up. oops

jJCcx3dmsJYahj4uUw96zQ.text: From the minute we walked in everyone was extremely welcoming. Not only is the ambience of epic proportion but the food is Fucking Amazing  (excuse my French) They care about your experience and it shows.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k1RcQ6rTQK68iIfiD1ZaUQ.text: Beauty & Essex blew us away! Walking in through a working pawn shop was a unique experience and opening the door into the dimly lit but beautifully outfitted bar was very cool.  We had a party of 11 and I was the only one with dietary limitations (of course). Our servers, Erin and Ian, found out what I needed to avoid and let me know with each course what I could and couldn't eat. We had the tasting menu and it was out of this world. From salad, to shrimp, to scallops, to lamb, to steak, to sorbet... phenomenal.   Our drinks were never empty and the food came out at the perfect pace so that we were neither rushing nor waiting for our next course.   Coming from a service industry background, I pay attention to things that others might not notice and I often get irritated by little things while eating out. That didn't happen at B & E even once thanks to Erin and Ian and the rest of the servers/food runners. The doorman even got me a band aid to help me get through the night on a sandal that was starting to bother my foot!  We had a fantastic experience and I would highly recommend it!

Euo_dYnWhIGLVE_YS56mxg.text: Came here to celebrate my birthday on a Friday night. I really wanted to like this place but it was just alright. My boyfriend and I had one drink each at the bar while waiting for other friends to arrive and the total for just that was $40 so be ready to spend some money. We ordered about 10 plates total and only one of them really stood out to me as amazing (the dumplings). I'm a fan of music playing in restaurants but the music here was so loud I couldn't talk to anyone except the person sitting directly next to me, yet my boyfriend and I agreed it was hard to hear the music at the same time the sound was not clear at all. For my "birthday dessert" they brought out a shot glass filled with what tasted like just whipped cream and it was filled almost halfway with sprinkles, not a fan. The 3 stars are mainly just for the decor.

e6jfeLfEvRnQV4xe_w2r4A.text: Coming to Vegas you have a ton of options when it comes to dining. My girlfriend and I stayed at Aria and went on yelp to find a nice but not to crazy of a place for dinner. We came to Beauty & Essex. Menu looked amazing so we booked our reservation. Got there a few minutes early, the front is rad. You walk into a pawn shop and go through a big back door. Let me just say the whole experience was amazing. The hostesses where awesome and got us seated right away. Our waitress Kaitlyn was awesome. Got our drinks and then gave us some good recommendations on a few dishes. The food was perfect we got a few key dishes. There was not one thing that we would have changed about the experience. From the hostesses up front to the manager of the place was amazing. Most places you go to have this lame boushie feeling. Not this place. We will for sure be coming back and we highly recommend this place.

9QikPcjLH0XNPU8JHkNmrQ.text: My sister and I went here and shared 4 plates.  Tuna poke tacos, grilled cheese dumplings with tomato soup, kale apple salad and the chorizo mac and cheese.  I loved all of it, especially the tacos and kale apple salad.  The grilled cheese dumplings were awesome but my only complaint about them was if you don't eat them all right away the soup gets cold fast since it's in the small spoons!

Iwc4ozTMY_1ljnqsKuyZVQ.text: We simply asked the waiter to bring us our meal from appetizer, lighter fare to heavy. Every single thing satisfied our comfort food craving but executed with a contemporary twist. Excellent way to try delicious bites without realizing you're past full and still want to try more. On the pricey side, and a bit loud for conversation... but you get lots of entertainment with the outfits [or lack of] from the other patrons.

wBO9DdQ3aNDrHDShkpFnbg.text: My husband and I ate here recently on his 40th birthday.  I made a reservation on Open Table for 6:30 and we were seated right away, with less than 10 other tables full.  We waited until 6:45 and nobody had come to our table - even the server pouring water skipped over us as he poured water for the table right next to us.  We got up to leave and let the girls at the hostess stand know what had happened.    One of the girls, Brianna, was apologetic and offered to send out some complimentary dishes if we wanted to give them another chance, seated in a different area.  We agreed and were sat with a very attentive server (Paulo?), who brought out a couple of popular dishes, at no charge to us.  Every dish we had was yummy, with my favorites being the tomato tartare, the grilled cheese dumplings with tomato soup, and the cauliflower.  (We ordered mostly side dishes)  My husband loved the bone marrow.  Brianna came to check on us during dinner, as well.  Good, craft cocktails, yummy food, the ambience and great customer service were much appreciated!

5WPhxCVyhnfjoT30oz5obQ.text: Very cool vibe, outstanding food - exceptionally loud. The scallops were fantastic as was the beef toast and meatballs. We were a very large party so they brought out a taste of everything it seemed...easily 20 courses ranging from seafood to steaks to salads to homemade donuts. Will return without a doubt

Oi7aPlowDeADBGVKPLk-ag.text: I really wanted to like it here. The food was ok; I expected more. What really did it for me was the service. It was awful. We were completely ignored and our waiter never made us feel welcomed. He was more attentive to the table next to us. Maybe because there were more people? It seemed strange. I don't think I will be back; it was disappointing to say the least.

su-Q8QnYi0ai655gwig9Iw.text: Incredible service. I am gluten free & they completely personalized all of my courses for each meal. We were attended to constantly, checking on drinks, food, and even getting new plates/utensils for every single course. The staff also gave us great recommendations for what to do following our delicious dinner. Highly recommend this place.

AbKLuL7OSXcHUEKN6s9Vcw.text: Group of 12. But Tuesday night. Good restaurants never seem to slow down this one included!  My first time here. With our luxury resort buyers and many of them include executive chefs. That's what so fun! Everybody eats from everybody's plate.   I think we had everything on the menu... Outstanding service, beautiful presentation and very reasonable prices.   What is it about carbs that keeps pulling me back in? The avocado toast, the barbecue fries, yum!!

G90O_U4mrJ7BLssUt9UbXA.text: It's Las Vegas secret! Such an amazing experience. The food, environment and music is absolutely perfect. Great times. I'm looking forward to coming back.

F0cfLe0JTvjdcFKZct8K8Q.text: This was my first time at Beauty & Essex as I have heard good things about the New York location. We made reservations for a party of 3 on a Sunday night and were promptly seated at a nice booth when we arrived.   The menu is tapas style where everything comes in smaller sharable servings. We ordered the following:   1. East & West Oysters - exactly what the name suggests and tasted fresh. No complaints! 2. Apple and Kale Salad - this was okay, it was a little on the sweet side for my taste but someone who enjoys kale salads would probably like this dish. 3. Yellowtail Sashimi - our favorite out of everything we ordered. It was situated in a citrus soy sauce which complemented the fish well. Tasted fresh and would've ordered more if we weren't full at the end. 4. Roasted Bone Marrow - good flavor with the coarse sea salt and fatty like it should be. Pairs nicely when spread on the toasted bread. 5. House-made Cavatelli - comes in a light red sauce with sausage. Tasty but not worth ordering at a restaurant like this as it's not as unique. 6. Avocado, Lemon, & Espelette - a fancy version of avocado toast with a hint of a tangy twist. I liked it but not sure if it's worth the price. Order seafood instead! 7. Tuna Poke Wonton Tacos - these were good but came less as tacos and more poke on small wonton cups. I love tuna so I enjoyed it. 8. Shishito Peppers - average and was a little on the oilier side but I'm not a fan of shishito peppers usually so that could be why.  In terms of drinks, I had a couple Emerald Gimlets. Wasn't overly sweet and the basil provided good balance. It looked and tasted like a craft cocktail - I recommend it.   Definitely try making reservations if you're looking for a dinnertime meal as the restaurant was full when we arrived at 7:30PM on a Sunday night. The experience you get by walking into the "pawn shop" and led into a secret side door is pretty neat in itself.

yCRBHGF9_HoIvDhYtltbEQ.text: Ambiance was dark, but beautiful. Service was good. The entrance through a pawn shop was cool!  We started with the Tuna Poke Wonton Tacos and Pulled Chicken Arepas  which were delicious, but tiny. For entree we had the Mediterranean Cauliflower which was okay, and the Szechuan Chili Dusted Scallops which were cooked well and nice and spicy.  Pricey and small dishes, but I'm used to that. Overall I would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room at Beauty &amp; Essex

Lfsr_P9X1SomxiJwcWQceg.text: This place was a tough review. I found my myself struggling to want to enjoy the experience but kept getting slapped in the face with the reality of eating slightly better than mediocre food at Ferrari prices. The restaurant has all the signs a of a promising culinary experience. When entering the restaurant there's a great facade of a pawn shop that is designed to emanate a speak easy style entrance. A back door behind the pawn shop display leads to a dark, interior designer assured looking restaurant with the usual Vegas hotness caliper of hostesses behind a desk.   I started with a dirty martini and instantly felt betrayed by the water-downed 18 dollar warm mixture. Even the cheese filled olives felt a gushy warm and soft mess as I mixed them with my wet martini sipping and chewing simultaneously ever so skillfully.   An interesting house salad it was. Comprised of tasty lettuce with a side spread of hummus topped with sunflower seeds. It was as though it focused on making a salad with a beauty and Essex twist.  Something special only found here it seemed to want to say. Successful on the twist and yet lacking any substantial flavor. My wife said to me "it's missing citrus or something. Agreed - Blandish it ''twas.   The main course was comprised of scallops, lamb chops, and a side of their macaroni. While the scallops were cooked to perfection I wasn't impressed by their accompanied puree carrot stuff that they sat upon. There was also some sort of shaved plastic like transparent things sitting on top of the scallops that were colored orange. I was expecting them to taste like cheese or something. However they were absolutely and surprisingly flavorless.  What were these transparent pedal like chips I thought to myself? the whole time I ate this orange mess. Distracting for sure and took away from the excellent scallops.   The lamb chops were ok. They came on a bed of polenta, which was also ok. What I remember most about the chops was the way the fat on them seemed to wrap around them and how I needed to go about not eating this slimy layer. Sometimes when a steak or lamb chop is cooked to perfection I'll cut through the meat and fat without favor and chomp on what may be, because it all looks, cuts, and taste so good. Not this time. No sir I made sure to peel that squishy tape layer of mush off whatever tasty morsels I could find.    The Macaroni killed it for me. I mean it was good but... it just wasn't expensive restaurant good. I know I know - how good can macaroni really be. Well believe it or not I've had macaroni that will knock you on your ass but this was like a flavor I expect to find at Cheesecake Factory style restaurants. It just wasn't on par with any expectations.   So speaking of expectations - vegas strip, premium prices, upscale ambience - I expect the food to be top notch. It just wasn't. It fell short. Not super short, but short enough to say it was ok but I won't come back again. Funny my wife said the same thing.

nQfANadpweY0GiCPsj9DeA.text: Finally, I made it to the place everyone's been telling me to go: Beauty and Essex!   Food: Here, the cuisine is very diverse and is all about sharing! Tapas style cuisine is how B & E operates! We tried some simple dishes like their onion rings,kale and apple salad, along with the poke tacos that came recommended. All of the food was amazing and delicious with just enjoy flavor. I did think the poke tacos should've come with 4 versus 3 as an even number versus most people like us paying for the 4th.  Drinks: Beauty & Essex has some Handcrafted cocktails to die for! We tried the Green with Envy (pretty spicy) and the Delorean which was perfectly savory! The purees and add ins were fresh and there was lots of love and time taken to make each drink.    Ambiance: B & E has a pretty cool vibe! There's a pawn shop storefront before you head into the restaurant which was a cool surprise. As you walk in for dinner, there's a mellow DJ playing casual music you can talk over while bopping around to. The decor was super eclectic. There was lots of good and pearl and black mixed with small elements that made the walls hard to not stare at!   Service: Everyone from the front staff to our server to the bartender and service staff made the experience a positive one! Each person was friendly while offering recommendations and checked in on our experience. They were quick but didn't make us feel rushed if you know what I mean.  Overall:  I can't wait to visit here again when I'm hanging out at the Cosmopolitan. B & E is one of the awesome places you find that remind you of just why the Cosmo is such a unique hotel compared to most. The environment is hip and casual while also being a tad upscale for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poke tacos
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dranks
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Delorean &amp; The Green with Envy

UIPSYyc7NoXa9jPb0Wi4ag.text: Our second time here, first time in new york, Had one of the best tasting steaks here... EVER! omg, $63 but it was pure joy. I didn't even have to use the sauces it came with because it was so dang good. The avocado toast was so dang good as well, and of course the grilled cheese in tomato soup dumplings are a must.   The service here is absolutely great - they filled up the water every single sip. The steak actually came out a lukewarm (not hot) and we told them, and they took it back and made us a new one. I don't mind that the steak was not served hot, but they still get 5 stars for remedying the stiuation.  Thank you guys!!

bpMZgbID8jIxL14ZkCKVhA.text: Beauty & Essex is a very beautiful restaurant. From our food choices, most of them are pretty good and some are just OK. You have to go in through the pawnshop which is kind of cool. It is a tapas style restaurant and the portions are small & made for sharing. So, definitely don't go too hungry. They do not have any type of bread service. We did get the artichoke flatbread which had good bread but the artichoke topping was cold and had very little artichoke. It seemed like it had more onions and garlic.  Next was the mac & cheese which really was good. I didn't care for the little pieces of ham too much. And as for their famous tomato soup dumplings, it really didn't blow my mind. And, it comes in six little tiny teaspoons. So very little of it.  Next was served the Thai shrimp and chili dusted scallops, both were a little spicy and very good. We did enjoy both of those.  Lastly, we got the caramel cinnamon apple dessert. It was just bland. Nothing special at all. They did try to bring a second exact dessert to our table & we only ordered one. Then, when we got the check we did notice that there were two charges, I'm glad that we noticed. The service was pretty good. The gentlemen were nicer than the ladies. At one point a lady asked how was dinner and I said "pretty good" and she smirked at me and said "it was good? Oh good." As if I was NOT allowed to say "pretty" good. There was a little sarcasm and fakeness with the two ladies. We had about four different servers which was a bit confusing. Overall, it was a nice experience. The restaurant is gorgeous and some of the food was very good. I don't know if I will come back. I would much rather go to STK next door, where there is more food and better service.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What are the desert, cinnamon caramel apple. It was pretty bland.
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The mac &amp; cheese which was very good. And the famous tomato soup dumplings,  that just didn&#39;t do the trick for us.
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gCLCdSuasp1FG0WKcdINdQ.text: Love the cocktails and the bartenders who are so professional and awesome!  We only came here to grab a drink and stayed in the bar area.  Very classy and cozy just like how I like it.  You'll have to make a reservation about 7 days or more in advanced to sit in the dining area.  If you're looking to spend some quiet alone time with your significant other and get away from the busy typical Vegas scene, I strongly recommend this bar!  Sophisticated drinks and classy atmosphere!

dwZj-iQMj8fKInvZxpNVIQ.text: This review is so long overdue having dined here twice. On the most recent visit with a coworker on a  "Tour De Cosmo" we came here for a dinner with amazing cocktails, bites, and most importantly dessert. K.C and Alison took fantastic care of us and made recommendations as their menu had changed from the last time I came in.   To start, I recommend the tuna poke tacos, Mexican corn ravioli, and their Thai shrimp. Everything was coursed out appropriately and K.C & Alison always made sure our waters were full, and utensils changed at every course.   I couldn't leave without their infamous doughnuts for dessert, and was ecstatic when they came out piping hot with three dipping sauces. I wish I wasn't completely stuffed or else I could have finished all of them by myself. Although the place is dark, it makes for an amazing dining experience where you completely forget you're in the Cosmopolitan at all. Highly, highly recommend for your next Vegas experience!

6AYw7CspgPKb0UqLXvzCkg.text: You have got to eat at Beauty & Essex during your Vegas trip. The food is out of this world and the service is fantastic! We ordered the grilled cheese dumplings, the empanadas, a dozen east coast oysters, the broccolini, the shrimp, and the donuts for dessert. Seriously some of the best food I have ever had in my life. Make sure you dress nicely or you'll feel out of place. I saw a guy there in cargo shorts and crocs and it was a disaster.

FPRt3hvwYBk0YyO8U0XRtA.text: SUCH an amazing place. We've been to lots of restaurants in Vegas - this was the best experience we've had in years. We got lucky and met chef Chris Santos, who came out and congratulated our table (mom just finished chemo). Really was incredible.   The grilled cheese dumplings and tomato soup bites were fantastic. Chicken meatballs were another favorite. We loved the toast. They let you add on additional bites to make sure everyone at your table is served at least one portion.   The service was outstanding, the atmosphere was so much fun, and the wine list was excellent.  The shop in the front was a great addition to the experience. Must visit!

KuTh7uIaeYkzaDZTeir0FQ.text: This was my second time in.    The first time I came here (and totally forgot to do a yelp review) we had a lot of food.  Over ordered so much that we were rolling out of the restaurant.  But the menu is so creative and everything sounds so interesting we just didn't know how to stop.  Shout outs to the tuna poke tacos and the roasted bone marrow.  I also had quite a few of the cocktails, most of which were very strong (good thing I had a lot of food to go with them).  Hello O.D.B. and Beauty Elixir.  Soooo gooooood.    The only thing that bothered me was that my bf at the time had to go back to the room to change his clothes in order to eat here.  When we did come back, someone wearing almost EXACTLY what he was wearing the first time was seated next to us.  Apparently, my ex's nice grey cargo shorts were not as good as the pastel plaid cargo ones on the guy next to us?  This time around, I came with a friend who said he felt under-dressed which does make sense.  The inside of this restaurant is dark and seriously sexy with all the spot lighting and necklaces.  The "booth" side of the table was a crushed blue velvet recamier.  Sexy AF.  We were't terribly hungry so we just ordered a few things but man again, the creativity is spot on and the food just tastes good.  I have also never tried a dark Spanish rose and it was quite excellent.  Might become my new fave.    The service here is always on point.  You will never run out of water.  And the food comes out well timed and explained to you.    Overall, this is a really nice spot to bring anyone, a date, your friends or family, for a great meal with excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mexican corn ravioli
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and cheese
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. East West oysters.

1-LLEiOULjXXTVVoj2H7gg.text: I've been to the New York location which is wonderful, but this visit was an EXPERIENCE. We were lucky enough to be sat in Apollo's section. I have never in my entire adult life had such impressive, impeccable, detailed service EVER. He is so passionate and genuine that it conveys through not only his words, but his energy. This man is a gem so I highly recommend you request him & hopefully you get lucky.   We went for a girlfriend's Birthday & had a drink as we waited to be sat. The ladies in the front were friendly,  beautiful, and had great customer service. Once our table was ready the magic began. We had 3 in our party which was perfect in regards to sharing plates. A lot of dishes are proportioned  perfectly for a smaller group fyi so we ordered a bunch of different plates to share.   The first thing to come out was the ahi wonton tacos (DELICIOUS), the smoked tomato soup & dumpling appetizer, then we had a shrimp dish, mac & cheese (I wouldn't order again), lamb, meatballs, a couple of special items compliments of the chef, a delicious birthday surprise of donuts with 3 miniature ice creams to share, & of course cocktails!!! I'd like to mention I typically don't eat lamb, but the way this was prepared literally tasted like heaven on earth. Omg, just order it and LIVE your best life lol. I will be back and the bar was set so incredibly high I'm weary to visit the LA one which is closest to me.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C0pfpuXlUHNLElKFSAR2Eg.text: One of my fav places at the Cosmo!! I LOVE the ambiance and the DJ plays really good music! Perfect for date night or groups. The Street corn Ravioli is everything!! The dumplings are phenomenal!! Everything is shareable!

5bwr7C1JK65fzrvK1CUCAw.text: Great atmosphere.  Excellent service.  Food was fast to come out and super hot.  It was also delicious!  Can't wait to come back!  We celebrated our anniversary here and they had a special anniversary dessert for us!   cocktails were also great, we tried the beauty elixir and green with envy.  They are specialty cocktails but both were good.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Celebration dinner!

ubJ-PucR-r_wF_SDXLBfxg.text: FRIDAY NIGHT DINNER: 10/5/2018  I made reservations in advance which helped because this place was packed at 845pm when we arrived. The waitress told us the dishes are to share, but they're pretty tiny, so you can eat on your own or share, up to you.  They suggested between 4-6 dishes for 2 people.  Tacos The best dish hands down was the ahi tuna tacos. We also ordered the octopus tacos, but don't waste your money. You can barely taste them and the ahi tuna knocked it out of the park. But beware, it's between $16-$18 each and you only get 3 tacos. You will still be hungry....  Entree We also ordered the mexican street corn ravioli - that was pretty innovative. It was truly a cool way to feel like your'e eating both mexican street corn and pasta. I'd get this again, it was around $20  We also ordered: Onion ring - hey no judging they looked good at our neighbors table (and they were)! Thai-style deep fried shirmp - 5 pieces of shrimp - so tasty and fully cooked  Dessert Les NYC Doughnuts - the dark chocolate fudge, berry & caramel sauces really made this dish 10/10.  Drink BUBBLES & BERRIES $17- ordered it with Titos (AMAZING) Veuve Clicquot Champagne, Belvedere Vodka, St. Germain Liqueur, Muddled Strawberries

PY57suJ3vAz3njrb6nRJPg.text: Amazing, lively ambiance, great music. The service was superb. Just about everything was amazing. My favs were the Thai shrimp and Pazzoli and chicken meat balls. The ravioli was good but not great. The pesto zucchini pasta looks much better than it tastes so I was disappointed with that one but the waiter was nice enough to take it off the bill. I was also not a fan of the flat bread as the toppings are all cold.

PJjwkNNfln003UiddXLJPg.text: Seriously one of the best dinners I've had the pleasure to experience. You have to walk through a pawn shop before you enter the restaurant and they offer a comp glass of champagne to the ladies. When you get into the restaurant it is dark, mysterious, decorated in jewelry and feels like a speakeasy. All of the staff are good looking as well :] The restaurant is quite loud but it's very fun.  Our server was Erin and she was super sweet, recommended amazing dishes for our table, and very personable with our large group!  Keep in mind everything is served as small plates, so you will want to order quite a few to share amongst the table. Some of my favorite things to try:  -The poke wonton tacos....mmmm omg I don't even like raw fish but the flavor in these were amazing -grilled cheese, smoked bacon, and tomato soup dumplings were small but delicious -my first time trying bone marrow and it was great -grilled salmon was the best I've ever had prepared -the lamb chops came up on a second to only Milo's next door but still fantastic -green with envy cocktail which had celery salt and was one of the best cocktails I've ever tried  I loved the food, ambience, atmosphere, and people. All of it put together made for a great evening!

ZEwiid38zd3Xso4KPsXc2Q.text: Classy Hot Spot with Good Eats! First off: Coolest entry into a restaurant! Small store front pawn shop (with actual things for sale) and the unassuming door which leads into the dimly lit and elegant dining rooms!   We were researching which restaurants were trendy and worth a visit. When Beauty and Essex came up in that list, we were glad we tried it out! Got a 7:45 reservation on a Thursday night on Open Table.   Taste: 9/10 Truffle Oil!  We shared the Mushroom Truffle flat bread, the sweet potato ravioli and the lamb. Peanut Butter sundae dessert.   Service: 10/10 Waitress didn't skip a beat, food came out very fast, super friendly and attentive.   Value: 9/10 For Vegas, this was exceptional value! Our bill total was about the same amount as if we had gone for burgers and wings in a moderate American sit down. Gotta love high end food that doesn't have an inflated price to match.   Bathrooms: Meh. This is the only thing we didn't like. Bathrooms are located outside the restaurant in the hall of the casino.   Location:  In the Cosmopolitan! Perfect location!  All in all, very cool experience, great food and awesome ambiance. We will be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jwIlzLyOo5k18l80aC63XA.text: The bae and I recently came here for a Friday night date night. I've been wanting to try their food forever and always heard great things. My little birdies did not disappoint, the food was great!   To start we had the Caesar toast and tomato soup dumplings. The toasts were very tasty and I loved the unique and delicious chicken skin topping. The dumplings though were by far my favorite part of the entire meal, a must try! For an entree we shared the burger. It was good, but nothing above the ordinary. It was also the perfect size to share. To finish we had the Kygo cloud nine dessert. It's super rich, but very good! Great for any chocolate lovers.   I do have to say one thing though I don't recommend this place as a romantic night out since it's super loud and club feeling. It's definitely great for a birthday dinner before a night at marquee though.

dcHo3gLCSxRzzeKXmvotsg.text: I was looking forward to eating here with such great reviews, but was very disappointed with the food!!! Servers were great.  Food: 1.) Chicken dumplings were lukewarm at best, this item should be served hot! 2.) dozen Oysters were soooo tiny and at $35.00 they should not have even offered these to paying customers... horrible! 3.) Chorizo mac and cheese: the Chorizo was so hard or gummy it was not eatable!   I am a "foodie" and dine out regularly at fine dinning establishments, but Beauty & Essex is one I can not recommend! Also the dinning room was very cold in temperature.

q9LqtshoTbPG02f2McE6YQ.text: Intimate dining experience and great for shared plates. Split the yellowtail sashimi, goat cheese mushroom pizzetta and pork tacos.  The pizzetta was amazing and the tacos were really good too. The yellowtail was decent but this is definitely not a sushi type restaurant so I would probably pass on that next time. Excellent service and good selection of wines and cocktails. They even have a vegan menu

TsjcwAxP78CKG7wYG64PoQ.text: My boyfriend and I came here for a date night and it was such an amazing experience. We had already ate dinner so we came for drinks and desert. The entire experience was just so fascinating. We entered through a pawn shop and walked inside. It's a dark, classy, elegant restaraunt. We had reservations so we got seated at a booth. We ordered the "Les, Nyc" Doughnuts and I believe my drink was called Green With Envy. They both tasted delicious and I have my server to thank for the suggestions. I can't remember her name but she was so welcoming and she walked us through the menu and answered all our questions. This was an amazing place to experience in LV and we will be coming here for dinner next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d3OFdEE1Lx2MpHpTAPhJiA.text: A delight, perfect for a special occasion.  My whole family joined for an absolutely scrumptious dinner at Beauty & Essex. I love the awesome secret entrance through the Pawn Shop, I live tiny intricacies of this sort!  Out of the 8 people at the table, there were 5 of us who preferred vegan and vegetarian options. They were happy to provide us with a vegan menu, and let me tell you.. it did NOT disappoint!  My cocktail was INSANITY, I loved the Pink Panther! But really, The whole meal was magical and I kept eating and eating until my stomach hurt.  To finish off the meal, we had these delightful alcoholic dessert shots which I also thoroughly recommend.  GO HERE!

oXgp4yyG5G2eofMZSDfsGw.text: Loud atmosphere, small portions, big price tag. Food quality and experience wasn't even great to explain the cost. Mediocre at the most! The place was so loud and dark that we couldn't even enjoy ourselves. Waitress was pushy and inconvenient... Sad experience since we only had two nights in town and one great dinner opportunity was missed. Fad type of place:(

Egr7ihjyZZFFV-MIxslYaw.text: I will start with the positive: The ambiance is on point- it feels super posh and chic-- it's a place you want to sit and have a drink in. Our server was superb- she was sweet, knowledgable and attentive.    Now for the food... We ordered the 'Chile Relleno' empanadas, Oven Braised Chicken Meatballs, a Flatbread of some sort and a nice bottle of pinot. The wine was great; I have nothing but praise for our wine! As for the empanadas, I think I could get better frozen empanadas from Trader Joes. They're ok if you want that frozen, heated in a convection oven type of a meal- which I do sometimes, but just not at top dollar. The meatballs were ok, a little hard- like maybe they put too much bread crumbs in the mix. They weren't the worst, but they had a sort of golf ball element to them. The flatbread was good, because hey- how can you screw up bread?   I think this place is great to come for a cocktail hour or a glass of wine at the bar while you wait for a table to open up next door. Just know you're paying for ambiance, not the quality of food.

y43QAmqbvOssHgb-4I4g7w.text: 3.5 star. A good experience, great atmosphere, great food. I rounded up to 4 stars because of the potential. I had the short rib steak with BBQ fries. The short ribs were amazing and the garnish was fantastic. The BBQ fries were also very good. My 3 issues were the short ribs came out warmish, not hot or even very warm. (I like very warm/hot food) also the fries seasoning was great but there was a little too much and was a little overwhelming at times. Also I sat toward the wall on a 2 person table the the AC vent was blowing at hurricane strength on me and my food. Please but some vent covers that directs the air in the center of the room.

SH0aHTfI--wY61I0KQyYPw.text: This place is super fun. It's a pawn shop on the 4th level of the Cosmopolitan. Go into the pawn shop and go through the door. It opens up to an amazing restaurant and bar.   All the food items are served tapa style so order a few things to share. The Lobster Roll was delicious by Chris Santos. I also got the Strawberry Bar which was liquid cheesecake frozen. Ummmm yum!   Fun place. Non pretentious. Everyone is friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pC_Y22KbRq4SmXxtXf4f0A.text: This place was incredible! There wasn't a single plate that we didn't love! I highly recommend the Korean fried chicken, the grilled cheese and tomato soup dumplings and the rib eye...which we could cut with a butter knife.

7ALvPGTX6G0aFf8C_AXFQQ.text: Amazing dining experience. From the decor to the food. We tried several dishes... being a party of 4 we were able to sample many dishes and leave perfectly full.  Drinks The Delorean  Madison Avenue  Both great, Delorean comes with no ice. Madison Avenue has ice.   Food items Salmon ceviche  Grilled cheese tomato dumplings  Empanadas  Street corn ravioli  Bone marrow  Tomato tartare  Sirloin   The bone marrow, street corn ravioli, empanadas were my favorite! The sirloin was also delicious it's just those 3 items were my favorite! The tartare was so good! The only fish that was a little bland was the ceviche. I would definitely pick a different seafood item over the ceviche.  Service was great. Attentive, but not overly involved. The noise level was perfect, we were able to hear each other perfectly. We loved our meal here and will definitely be back soon!

2jxZtE9yypQTuQrITcw5jg.text: As expected, I was entranced by this place. Super unique decorations, and beautiful presentation of the dishes. I love that it's so easy to make reservations online.   As many have said, the tomato soup dumplings are simply to die for. Nothing else I tried could compare.  The server was also super nice, and I just love the upscale, dressy atmosphere. The only downside I felt was how friggin loud it was. But I suppose that is not something they can help with such a popular Vegas restaurant.   I know we'll be coming back to sample more of their menu in the future. I just love top-notch restaurants like these.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g6tWKlx18pKYAguHCB3wdQ.text: Came here with two friends a few days ago for drinks + dinner! We all got the Bubbles & Berries, which was amazing. We shared the Mediterranean cauliflower, yellowtail sashimi, and the spaghettini. I loved the sashimi a lot, and the spaghettini came in a large portion that filled up all 3 of us. We also got the lemon raspberry cheesecake dessert which was really good but small. The only thing that was annoying was that the waitress made a snarky remark about not having enough food when we ordered, but it was more than enough and I left really full.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail Sashimi

25vNbqbwVuvB1Q1gH3E0YA.text: This place is too cute! I stumbled upon this place at Cosmo with a few friends because an onsite event was cancelled. The entrance is a pawn shop and you have to go through a somewhat hidden door that leads you to the entire restaurant! We really just wanted to chill at a bar but we ended up just getting seated at the table.   We didn't order any entrees/appetizers since none of us were hungry. Each of us ordered a cocktail and I got the Beauty Elixir which was pretty good! They had some other interesting cocktails that I definitely want to try out next time.   Besides cocktails, we ordered desserts! Donuts were pretty bomb and the one I loved the most was the Kygo Cloud 9!! Oh my gosh, can I please go back and take another bite of that deliciousness?!  Overall, I would definitely come back to try their brunch, heard it's pretty awesome. I do recommend this place for a date night if you don't mind the crowd and noise! It got pretty busy and loud as it got closer to dinner rush.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lPcWvHHLqLxIJJxBcxySGg.text: We were super excited about eating here, and the menu sounded amazing, but our expectations were just not met. Overall, the experience was okay, but not great.   First of all, the place was so incredibly loud that I literally couldn't talk to my husband who was two feet across the table from me. We could also barely hear our server, and I felt like I had to yell at him to order. There was a party of about twenty women right behind us who kept cheering and yelling and singing and honestly just being obnoxious. I understand that there is little the staff could've done to quiet them down, but maybe they could've been seated in one of the more private areas?   For cocktails, we each ordered the woodsman, which was meh. It was a little flavorless and really didn't taste like the description.   For food, we split: - caesar toast: very tasty and fresh; one of my favorites - k-town bao burger: needed more sauce and seasoning - chile relleno empanadas: quite yummy, but a little cold when they came out - grilled cheese, smoked bacon, and tomato soup dumplings: our favorite dish; they were fun and inventive - roasted mushroom pizzetta: underwhelming; I didn't taste the truffle cream at all - carrot layer cake: the cake itself was great, but the ice cream just felt unnecessary and didn't complement the cake very well  I thought it was a bit annoying that you had to exit the restaurant to use the bathroom. The pawn shop idea in the front seems cute, but it's just another barrier when getting to the bathroom, especially since so many people were crowded in there.

DpskO6oMlpzA3pfap6w_jA.text: Had drinks at the bar located just outside the main door to go into the restaurant. Most people do not know it's a bar because it looks like a shop selling random items. That's what we call a speakeasy. Our bartender, Chelsea, was delightful and a True professional. She catered to all our needs and made sure we had a great time! Thanks again for taking care of us.

a86onGvYmOOHzO4oXRPlkg.text: Atmosphere and vibes are very chill. You can get cozy over drinks or a nice meal in a dark lit environment with classy decor. This place is unique as it looks like like a pawn shop as you walk in. You can buy jewelry and some other items on display. As far as the menu goes ... it's not traditional and is kind of all over the place. Most plates can be shared. I had a hard time deciding what I wanted but here are my must have recommendations: Thai style deep fried shrimp and their char grilled green beans. The salmon was also very tasty. I would not recommend the artichoke grilled flat bread or the spaghettini. They also had some good cocktails.  Overall a good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8c77lvBeVxdWJ2jNh1M_XQ.text: Went here for a bachelorette party and it did not disappoint! Great atmosphere and tasty food.  We shared: roasted bone marrow, grilled cheese dumplings(pictured), broccolini, bbq fries, chorizo mac and cheese, and oven braised chicken meatballs. Literally all of it was delicious. The bone marrow you scoop out of the bone and pile on top a piece of toast along with a nice marmalade. The broccolini sauce was amazing. Five stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p_15AmNRrUapGH5dFppxVw.text: Fantastic place for sharing. Great atmosphere and great service. My wife and I specifically loved the sashimi app, lamb chops, and Thai shrimp.  Will be visiting the location again and also on New York.

I7lQkO4f2Nk0QsamBhWTUA.text: Las Vegas location. Food was good! Atmosphere was not conducive to a good meal. Service was sub par and music was WAY too loud.

CquNlKERgh1aWsHdkY3UeQ.text: Hmmm... atmosphere was lovely, but the food left something to be desired. Pretty *good* but at the end of the meal I walked away realizing we paid for ambiance more than we did a quality meal. For those prices, you want to be somewhat blown away by your meal and it fell a little flat. Dishes were kind of cold, kind of dry, kind of salty. The fried Thai shrimp was my fave. Indifferent overall.

6edgGclXGqFJRIggffuXpQ.text: This place is awesome!!! Has a very interesting entrance. Service was amazing! Erin you were awesome and definitely knowledgeable! Thank you for recommending the cheddar cheese dumplings with tomato soup by far the best ! Drinks were great as well . Everything we tried was absolutely delicious ! Even better our service was amazing and everyone was super attentive !

rpaGu3uWR4GouJAB873sbg.text: First time here and the food is incredible. Concept is very cool as you enter a pawn shop first and casually walk in through the unassuming door to find a hidden restaurant club. We'll be back...

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front lounge

R5n_8g0bcFY8ovSD7sEIFg.text: Nice vibe and okay service but the food is mediocre. The chicken arepas and lamb chops were both on the salty side. The Caesar toast was interesting but nothing to write home about. The carrot cake was tasty but not good enough to make up for the dinner. The drinks are inventive and flavorful--they were probably the highlight of the evening. Nothing about this place is terrible  but nothing makes it stand apart from other Vegas restaurants with great food and beverage offerings.

pl2VQiZ_qO3XJVKVq_qEFw.text: When I heard that Beauty and Essex was opening their second location in Las Vegas I was so excited. It is my favorite restaurant in New York City and Las Vegas is much closer to LA than NYC. That being said, I was a little bit underwhelmed by my visit. Points were automatically lost when we had a reservation and still had to wait to be seated for 45 mins. With many shows and people needing to be places in Vegas, they need to get better about sticking to their reservation times. When seated, we were put right next to the POS computer stand which was a little annoying because servers would keep coming by to grab plates or menus. The food was good and the service was great once we were seated though. As always, the grilled cheese and tomato soup dumplings were amazing. The real disappointment was the lobster rolls. This is certainly a dish that you can skip. The server even suggested we get an extra one to split the order evenly since they generally come with 3. Needless to say the extra $11 or something crazy was a waste because we didn't even want to eat it. We had to rush through our meal because we were already 45 minutes behind. Call me crazy, but when I drop $200 on a meal I would have liked to savor and enjoy it a bit more. I am not sure what it was, but this location lost a bit of the magic that it had in NYC. I have reservations for the new location that just opened up in LA in a couple of weeks so hopefully, that one will impress me a bit more!

gr9jyPzTWnpM6UKC1ewI7w.text: My husband and I shared five small plates and it was perfect.  The scallops were to die for - we closed our eyes and savored them.  The mac n cheese was good, very good, even... but it's just Mac n cheese.  :). We also had the empanadas, Thai shrimp, and something I can't remember. All very good, but those scallops!  I had a gimlet that was a bit heavy on the liquor for my tastes, but my husband got something with Beauty in the name (beauty elixir, maybe?) and it tasted like a strawberry starburst.  :). Over all, money well spent - but it was really loud by the time we left, which was around 9:30pm.

rXCdmpARhUYeKIb-uVkY7w.text: This was our second time at this beyond amazing restaurant. Atmosphere, service and food are perfection. Grilled cheese tomato spoons and bone marrow are the yummiest things in the planet! You must end the meal with the homemade donuts and dipping sauces. Kill. Me.

V_krgWNdBWLi9KcjzJfT3Q.text: Tuna Poke Wonton Tacos. Caesar Toast. Chile Relleno Empanadas. Grilled Cheese, Smoked Bacon & Tomato Soup Dumplings. Short Rib Mac & Cheese. Oven Braised Chicken Meatballs.  Absolutely LOVE this place!! A True Vegas GEM. The food is DELICIOUS and the decor is full of GLITZ, GLAM & SPARKLE!! Our server Ian was ON POINT!!  The Mister and I shall definitely be back!!

H1ImmWAn4d5cVv9C-_JIeQ.text: Had a delicious experience dining here on vacation. Tasty and unique small plates with bold flavors. Ordered 6 items for our table of four and left full and satisfied. The chicken meatballs are to die for!

z7l3cqCbS4GbFaYdPmN48g.text: I was not expecting to love this place so much. I figured it was more about the vibe and novelty of the whole Beauty and Essex pawn shop in the front gimmick... I was so so so wrong, and I am so glad I was. I hadn't read the reviews and hadn't heard anything from friends who had dined here but I'd love to shout from the rooftops about how delicious the food here is, and exciting too..  Our waiter was amazing, I think his name was David (?), he was top notch and wish I could just have him as my waiter everywhere I go. Stellar job, amazing attitude, he made the experience fun and we were so grateful to have him as our waiter. That being said, I am not sure if I've had a dinner that I enjoyed as much as I enjoyed our dinner at Beauty & Essex. We ordered the ahi tuna tacos, and then we ordered another order of them after we finished our entire meal - yes, they were that good. The flavors are perfectly balanced and these are just SO good. We may have gone back the next night and picked up a quick order of these "to go" because we could not stop thinking about them! We also ordered caesar toast (yum!), the french onion dumplings (holy moly!), the grilled cheese and tomato soup dumpling (amazing!), scallops (prepared perfectly) and... I think that was it. Oh, and bone marrow (ahh, why you gotta be so good?!).   Everything was phenomenal and I could have sat there all night, eating everything over and over and over again.  We had to get dessert, right? The donuts are killer good. Light and fluffy served with 3 sauces (chocolate, butterscotchy caramel and a raspberry sauce) - *sigh* these were so freakin' amazing. We also ordered the PB ice cream thing which comes topped with pretzels, I don't even have the words to describe how amazing this one was. Beauty & Essex, you done did a great job and I cannot wait to come back. Everyone who works here is so friendly and you really don't get that pretentious vegas vibe that a lot of other places give off. Oh, it is loud inside, but you wont be talking much because the food is really that incredible and there are no words great enough to describe it.  I really hope this place stays as good as it is right now and doesn't go through that rough patch of bad service and inconsistency. B&E, thank you for such a wonderful experience, and to our waiter, you are the man!

E-sJ1Yv0J7UlB1Fd5kxboQ.text: Great food and ambiance! Would definitely return! The only complaint was that we made reservations and still had to wait 45 mins to get our table.

DE1hpDfI6vAqZ8MTXP7dcA.text: Amazing food, great atmosphere, quality craft cocktails. Loved the grilled cheese and tomato soup bites. The Yellowtail sashimi was AMAZING. speak-easy feel, and you enter in through a functioning pawn shop. Must-see!

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocktails, ravioli, meatballs, yellowtail sashimi, short rib Mac and cheese, tuna ceviche. So amazing!

vGfUSB8XwxK-mmvTW4Gjyg.text: Excellent cocktails and I love the concept. Favorite dishes for me: the scallops, lamb and the grilled cheese in tomato soup(comes in ramen spoons). We will be back soon.

G8rd6nQgQm60OR8j6oa7qw.text: Probably my favorite restaurant in Vegas! Do yourself a favor and order the grilled cheese and bacon dumplings and the Brussels sprouts. So delicious and the vibe is just as amazing as the food, you will love it here!

FTLiyYJ5M686CeYN_8lWfg.text: Found this place by searching for best Las Vegas eateries... While in the Cosmo you would never know it's there as it's 'hidden' through a pawn shop entrance, giving it a bit of a secret society appeal. The very first thing i noticed was how LOUD it was, even at the host stand we could barely hear each other and it got worse as we progressed to the back to our table. The guests has to speak loudly because the club music was over the top loud. It was like a JOB to be able to listen to and comprehend our server... Pros: great speakeasy feel and hidden, FOOD was amazing, server was wonderful. Cons: LOUD, too LOUD for quiet conversations, tables too small for a tapas restaurant and very very crowded.

cI4C1mEx2810HdO_cfPiYw.text: We went for our anniversary last month, and loved this place!! The atmosphere was so cool! The spoon handles of grilled cheese dumplings in tomato soup were to die for! The elote style scallops were amazing as well. We had Kaitlyn as our server and she was super nice and informative. Everything is small plate style so we each ordered two things. A little pricey but well worth it! We can't wait to go back!!

bJbFGUWDU-ad19M4AXFOFA.text: When I go out to eat, I pay attention to detail. This is what happens when you've worked in restaurants for over 10 years. I came to B&E for my birthday and am usually not WOWed but this experience was well above my expectations. I didn't try a single dish that I didn't love. The wait staff was VERY attentive, making great recommendations based on our dietary restrictions. You can tell that the staff is well trained and know proper etiquette when it comes to clearing dishes and prepping the table for the next course. Anthony, the manager, even came to our table and personally introduced himself and made sure we had everything we needed. This is how a restaurant should operate. 5 stars, a must try for food connoisseur and those who appreciate A1 service. Tao Group for the win. Thank you for making my experience one to remember.

XSMS5R6ATRBTPJv103Rvzg.text: Hands down the best restaurant I have ever been to! The inside is stunning. Beautiful decor and the lights are amazing. Note- it is rather dark inside, which is ok for me. Service was great and suggestions were on point. Food we had- Tuna Wontons, Shrimp Cocktail, Steak Bread (one of the best things I have ever eaten) grilled cheese and tomato soup bites (cool presentation), and Chicken Meatballs.

pjWL0F2KNTtH1car3sOkMg.text: This place is amazing! The ambiance is gorgeous...very Great Gatsbyish in a tasteful way. And the food was even better than the ambiance! We had the tuna poke tacos, fried shrimp, filet mignon and and side of cauliflower and it was all DELICIOUS. Also, order the Emerald Gimlet cocktail. It was one of the best cocktails I've ever had! This place is a must if you're coming to Vegas and want a delectable, romantic dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the decor! Unique and tasteful!

ol3dD0VybX8_F6sMw9cLHw.text: This was one of the best meals I have had in a long time. The dishes were phenomenal and unique combinations--personally my favorites were the mexican street corn ravioli, grilled cheese tomato soup dumplings, and the scallops which were cooked fantastically. Service was good, drinks were good and we were seated in a timely fashion. Definitely worth the price and would go back/recommend

keSLPS7599CtSjm8gyEFsQ.text: This place is so amazing! I had the scallops, lobster tail, Brussel sprouts, and grilled cheese with tomato soup and everything was so flavorful and bomb!

0wiCnqbVEl1-M0Z4ihPDng.text: Came here for the first time, excellent service! I had just finished playing a tournament at the Venetian. I wasn't judged for my adidas jump suit I was wearing or taking of my shoes at the dinner table. I ordered the yellowtail sashimi appetizer, the tomahawk ribeye, lamp chops, filet migon & roasted brussel sprouts. It was amazing! Great food & ambience.

VKxQsFRtxv9uZkdezHT7qw.text: Cute place 'hidden' behind a pawn shop looking storefront. Located on the Eastside of the Cosmopolitan, perfectly situated near the East elevator of self parking.  A great place to pregame before Marquee or just hang with some friends.

tv2UQptb6G2xzO9503YV6g.text: My husband and I had dinner here last night.  We absolutely loved this place. We've eaten at Beauty and Essex in NYC and were curious how they would recreate it in Vegas.   While it doesn't feel as authentic, because it is in The Cosmopolitan and not the Lower East Side, this 9 week old restaurant still managed to pull off an over the top cool vibe.  We loved the build out with the Pawn Shop in the front again and then the whole different world behind the secret door.   The DJ was great.  She set a great mood.   We shared the tuna tacos, chicken meatballs with a truffle sauce and grilled cheese smoked bacon and tomato soup dumplings.  The tuna tacos were excellent, but the other 2 dishes were to die for. Just out of this world.   The only negative thing we have to say about this place, was that the male hosts at the check in area were quite rude and had serious attitudes.   We waited for a little bit at the bar, because we were a little early and did end up waiting past our reservation time.   We very much enjoyed the blonde bartender at the bar. I wish I asked her her name. She said she has been with the Tao Group at some of their other properties. She was very warm and friendly. We felt like we were watching an artist make drinks.  She suggest the Pink Panther and I really enjoyed the drink.   The Tao Group has another winner on its hands. Im still thinking about those meatballs and dumplings.

HxjDgkvTORRAx_88EBx-tg.text: Ate here tonight. LITERALLY THE worst food I've ever had. I'm from the coast of NC and know seafood. My body also knows/tells me when to not eat something...that was tonight after ordering a $95 seafood dinner. Oysters and clams were nothing less than rotten. LITERALLY. I still can't get the smell off my hands. No one apologized, blinked an eye when they saw I sent back 98% of my  $95 meal. There was 3 bites taken out. I'm staying at the Cosmopolitan. Not shy of spending  $.....where it's worth it. #dontgetsick

DqZC_SNKoPyQfkQZeZ0WTg.text: Wow what a great experience. Wifey started with the basil & cucumber cocktail and she liked it so much she ordered another. Wifey may have been in a boozer mood but she loved loved loved the meal...as did I. Started with oysters (slurp!), yellowtail sashimi with a ponzu sauce (Damn!), the grilled cheese with roasted tomato soup (double damn!). Then we had the amazing smashed avocado toast. Lastly we had the scallops and they were cooked to perfection. Wifey says we will definitely be back!!

5Qk-oFFDn74E2kzGJ1-2BQ.text: This is the LOUDEST restaurant we have ever been to IN OUR LIVES! If you enjoy yelling across the table after a long day at the trade shows you will enjoy this place. If you enjoy l-o-n-g interludes between courses you will enjoy this place. If you enjoy what is supposed to be hot food served room temp you will enjoy this place. We tried the lobster rolls, grilled cheese spoons, onion rings, and scallops. ALL were ok nothing was great. The restaurant is beautiful but would we come back? NO!

FICGAhTjxbJTtGF36jt5Ug.text: Cold food, small portions, expensive. First we ordered the ahi tacos for an appetizer. $17 for three bite sized tacos. Would you like to purchase another taco sir for $4? Sure. Next we ordered a main course, chicken meatballs. $21. Would you like to order another meatball sir? No. The meatballs were served with a sauce on top and nothing else. They were cold. Not that tasty. Next was the "grilled cheese sandwiches" with tomato soup. $19. The so-called grilled cheese sandwiches were tiny soggy, round sandwiches served on 7 plastic spoons. No bread service. I purchased bread that came out over toasted and dry. Hardly a meal. A glass of champagne and a beer and the tab was well over $100. We left and ate a proper dinner somewhere else. Atmosphere and service were great.

iluEAn_akDSUQe9tqMmTsQ.text: I love everything about this place! Walking through the pawn shop to get to the restaurant to walk into one of the most happening restaurants I've ever been to. The shared plates setting was awesome. I loved the avocado toast, the amazing mini wonton tacos, and really everything we ordered. My earl of pearl drink was so good. Seriously try this place! The one downside was the restaurant was crazy loud.

lQQuHCidLUocokCjsAoopQ.text: Swanky tapas restaurant with an excellent atmosphere. From the entrance to the speedy attentive service, excellent food with just the right portions, we enjoyed every moment of our time at this new hot spot on the strip in The Cosmopolitan.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DG6KWSRRfELWeBSnrh7nQg.text: We took our daughter here for her 18 Bday with about 10 friends. Have to say I was very impressed by everything the food which she said was the best meal of her life and the ambiance was awesome. Service was stellar and on point the whole evening. Cant wait to go back with some friends to eat and hand out. We will definitely be coming back here for sure.

OBZr5_pOe7bt70OHTsvotA.text: This restaurant is sexy! Great ambience and service. We have been to the one in New York and loved it so thought we must try the vegas location. This location is more of just a restaurant whereas the other one was very loungey club/restaurant but its unique tapas style/shared plates are cozy. Lots of unique dishes. Dim lighting, funky style but very classy - we loved it. It is a bit pricey, but worth it.

1_wuJN2krXtMDu2TzoExqA.text: We stopped by Beauty & Essex on a whim on our first day for vacation in Vegas. From the beginning with the impeccable service to the amazing food this is not only one of the best dinners we have had in Vegas this is one of the best meals we have had ever. We told our server we were in a time crunch and they not only brought the food out in a timely manner, but every plate we had tasted fresh and was amazing. If you are looking for a place to eat in Vegas definitely consider Beauty & Essex,

QHBWISPEZY_0s7-4c7xywQ.text: This place is cool. Walking thru a pawn shop into a speakeasy setting was a first. Inside was great and the small plates were too. Really good place for a group of friends to share dishes. Expect to spend $50pp since you'll be ordering multiple dishes.

9tGzbAeg6pxK_jBCTBwCOQ.text: the speakeasy type entrance lets you know you're in for a unique experience, and they won't disappoint. drinks were fantastic & everything on the menu was delicious. we ordered many different options (for picky eaters) and all were impressed.

I6R39w3DzSRuSKLFS08h2A.text: Amazing dinner. Best in Vegas!! The ambiance is amazing and the food is even better. Every dish and drink are a work of art and taste wonderful. Come early to browse in the Pawn Shop and then go out the door into the restaurant. The necklaces and mirrors really add to cool vibe. Couldn't recommend this place more!

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TlXkI27yWdWYBRJI3mAzrA.text: While in Vegas unsure of where exactly to have dinner, I had remembered that Beauty & Essex just opened a month or so before. We had passed by while sightseeing on the strip and I absolutely love it in my city of NYC. So why not go again?! Excited to try and show my bf what an awesome restaurant this is, we went for dinner. Date night in full effect. I had made a rsvp. Upon arrival, we checked in with the lovely hostess and were told that our table was not ready if we could wait. She gave me a buzzer. Ok no problem. So we sat down at the lounge area and ordered a drink. It was nice to relax. My drink got there and not even 5 mins the buzzer went off. We were then seated in the main dining room. Checking out the menu, I was kind of disappointed at the fact that some of the items I loved in the NYC menu were not offered here. For example, the short ribs with the hush puppies was no where to be found on the menu. What was on it was the short rib mac and cheese. So I ordered that. Also we ordered a tostada or pizza of some sort. It wasnt wow but was delish nonetheless. I ordered a hennessy on the rocks just to compliment the meal. I left satisfied yet not full. The food was just the right amount. I was not wowed here like at the one in NYC, but my dining experience was nice. I shall come back to see if they raised the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib mac and cheese.

v9zXodK9W0k0LR3xcfJ8eg.text: After dinner we came to Beauty & Essex for a cocktail and dessert. My favorite drink is super girly and made with what every girl loves.... Champagne!! It's called Bubbles & Berries made with champagne, Belvedere vodka, St. Germaine liqueur and muddles strawberries. Have 1, 2, or 3 after all who's counting. My go to dessert is the Strawberry Shortcake Bars. Liquid cheesecake, white chocolate and cap' n crunch. Of course these had to be created by a women because who else would figure out how to put Heaven on a stick?!!

aPiOy-30qCjX2soHPGzQhw.text: So very excited to tryout after reviews, very cool vibe, was loud but looked forward to the dinner. Our problem was after waiting for almost an hour in the bar to be seated, we saw several couples who had arrived after us be taken to their tables.  My husband checked and they said they were running behind and they gave us a card for free appetizer, which would have been fine but we never saw a server in the bar.  Checked back and was told there was 1 reservation ahead of us, so great we would finally be able to order some food(starving by this point). I then saw 4 couples taken to tables ahead of us, at that point we had been waiting for our table for an hour and half and had enough.  Our evening was spoiled and I can't even believe we waited as long as we did! So very disappointing

2FBl828BfTWy8cScHrVMxw.text: This place has a great atmosphere, delicious cocktails and the food is amazing--pretty much everything you want in a restaurant. The "bubbles" cocktail is my favorite. Surprisingly the kale salad was the biggest hit even with non-kale loving eaters! We lived everything we tried!

e6PxQtwBRMTdbUJDnBlNOw.text: Had a great evening here with two other couples. While the music was a bit loud and made it hard to hear, we all enjoyed the dishes we picked. The poke tacos were a favorite of our group along with the kale salad and the unique Mac and cheese.   The vodka gimlet with basil and lime was refreshing, smooth, and delicious.  For dessert we split the homemade donuts with the dipping sauces. Again delicious!  We all found the atmosphere fun. The decor was clever and fit the pawn store theme in a classy way.

lZLnfjPBkqbwypSzYU7p1g.text: Solid, solid place. This used to be the location of a restaurant I liked very much (I forgot the name) but Beauty and Essex made it cooler. The front of the restaurant is a shop of some sort and then there is this door that leads into the restaurant that feels like you're taken into a speakeasy or another world. I've been to a lot of Vegas restaurants but this entrance was definitely cool. We had a variety of things, tuna tacos, k bao burger, thai shrimp, salmon, caesar salad toast, and chocolate tartes. Toast and salmon were good and everything else was great. Drinks were good and so was service. I'll definitely come back and if you want Vegas vibe at a restaurant, this is definitely as Vegas as it gets.

taEQbMUqAoHcYUUixulLbg.text: It's a gorgeous space.  Loud and maybe on the smaller side but beautiful inside.  We called to move our reservation from 8:30pm to 7:30pm and they accommodated no problem.  We called when we were lost in the Cosmo and said we would be there soon.  We didn't get seated 'til about 8:30. They comped a round of drinks, a round of shots and an appetizer.  We were a party of 5 and shared the filet, lamb chops, crab legs, salmon, scallops, mac n cheese, grilled cheese bites with tomato soup, and green beans. Food was good and did not feel heavy at all for the amount we ate.  However, something didn't sit right with two of us.  One ended up sick (as in, threw up within hours) and I had an unsettled stomach.  Not the best feeling after a meal.    So, that, combined with the hour wait (with a reservation), left me underwhelmed.  Glad I went and checked it out but I wouldn't go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XMrxRYnAfUfXG3TlQ6Xf3Q.text: Dear Chef Chris Santos,  Although you are one of the pickiest judges on the show "Chopped", after dining at your restaurant, I appreciate your judgement somuch more.....  Why? Well, perhaps because now I understad what your standards are when it comes to  flavor, presentation and creativity, the 3 main components that the Chefs get rated on the show....  The BBQ thai chicken was truly divine...... The chicken was cooked to perfection while marinated in BBQ sauce along with lemongrass & ginger sauce... And to make the dish even more amazing, there was this delicious parsnip puree flavored with coconut cream......   The tuna was as amazingly delicious as the chicken, perhaps more....It was seared to perfection, served with delicious yellow & green beans....  As a huge onion ring hater, I got addicted to the onion rings served here..... The batter was not too thick but flavorful.... The onions were seasoned perfectly while being sweet and delicious.....  I would have said, I can't wait to dine here again when I come to Sin City next, but guess what?! They are opening  another B&E location  in DTLA this January!   Anyways, Chef Santos, you are my favorite judge on Chopped now....  Thank you and you are welcome...:-)

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Emerald gimlet.... Sweet basil infused drink with vodka....
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ thai chicken with lemon grass..... Enough said.
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get the Tuna.... Trust me!

a4QMLrUmrc6srgUggD6pIw.text: The experience was amazing. Perfect place for a date. Overall i think the food was equally great. My personal favorite was the avocado on the toast. The bread really made the appetizer. The avocado was perfectly salted and of course it was chunky the way i like it. Drinks were also reasonable

dyuSD0JZrQK7uLKOM0TeMg.text: We've eaten a few times. The food is okay but it's really the atmosphere that keeps up coming back. The bar is nice and the concept is fun

E0frufseW9DaOneR3odM7g.text: Wow this place is amazing, 1) Location is inside the Cosmopolitan on the Vegas Strip!!! 2) Cool factor 5 stars! 3) Chris Santos!! 4) Decor! 5) The FOOD!!!  Our party of 3 started with Chili relleno empenadas amazing but way too small for an appetizer, tried vegetarian pasta dishes, asked for the egg to be left off...came anyway, Thank God were not on "Chopped" woulda been cut... it was still good! also lamb burger and fries were good, The Thai shrimp dish was delish, but there was nothing else on the plate?!! well to eat anyway... there was a few noodles for looks but Chris... when you judge you always say... nothing on the plate you can't eat... so Wth?!!!   So yes I recommend going there, but know this going in.... It's gonna cost you!! After our meal leaving my daughter ran into Chris who was very nice in person and took a pix with her, thanks Chris it was a highlight!!

2U2i9wtkJUoN4ae92y3AOw.text: Totally love the vibe of this place & the store front with hidden entrance. We sat in the lounge for cocktails before our reservation. It was lush and blinged out with beautiful chandeliers. There was a D.J. playing great music. Service was on point & everything that landed on our table was enjoyed by all.   We ordered a variety of dishes to share which included The Roasted Bone Marrow, Chile Relleno Empenadas, K-Town Bao Burger, Oven Braised Chicken Meatballs, Mexican Street Corn Ravioli and plain MAC & Cheese made for my 10 year old at our request.   We ended this fun and amazing experience with The Carrot Layer Cake & "Les, Nyc" Doughnuts.   Will be back for sure!

zc29CF7_VkBXCPsAfppjVw.text: Top notch everything! Coming from NYC and Food Network's Chris Santos, B&E was already an experienced restaurant that knows how to provide a great experience. If you come with a group of all girls, you are treated to a glass of Prosecco in a little lounge area. You then enter the restaurant through what looks to be an upscale pawn shop and make your way over to the large door that transports you into the world of beauty. Every bit of decor is well thought out, from the gorgeous lighting fixtures in the entry which function as a work of art in themselves, to the frames with vintage necklaces hanging in them which create a faux wall. There is a bar/lounge and even a Dj spinning. Every staff member is courteous, experienced, and professional.  You don't have to spend a ton of money here although the atmosphere is upscale. Cocktails are on the pricey side so if you leave those out, your bill won't be too high. Food is meant to be shared family style and comes out pretty quickly. I wish they would have paced it a little better. But between 7 of us we shared 5 dishes and ordered one cocktail, and only spent $26 each after a generous tip. The food was phenomenal, and some dishes were quite unique.   The most unique dish was the French Onion Soup Dumplings. They are served in a little dish topped with a huge melted layer of cheese, and you pick it up with the toothpick. It gives you a burst of flavor! The Oven Braised Chicken Meatballs were another favorite of mine. You are served 3 large, juicy meatballs topped with a mound of whipped ricotta, sitting in a wild mushroom and truffle sauce. These are a must. The Garganelli is a lamb bolognese instead of beef, so the flavor was a little odd to me and this was the only dish I would pass on.   As for the desserts, we were served a complimentary sampler platter. The Black Bottomed Butterscotch Pot de Creme was out of this world! The butterscotch was so smooth and creamy, with the perfect amount of sweetness. I basically ate this whole thing by myself. Another favorite was the Spiked Root Beer Float Shot. This was so unique and fun, and even had sprinkles in it. So much more on the menu sounded great that I can't wait to come back the next time I am in Vegas. Be sure to make a reservation far in advance because it gets packed in there.

9ScHGmK-vrjNG8d4P1qhng.text: Wonderful dinner for a large group at Beauty & Essex. Great for large parties who are cool with sharing plates. They do a decent job of recreating the vibe of the NYC original, but in grand Vegas scale. Staff is accommodating, knowledgeable, and will adjust any of your orders so everyone can have a taste. Recommend the tuna poke tacos and the bone marrow toast is a special presentation. Cocktail menu has a lot of interesting twists on the classics, try the Pink Panther. Not 5 stars because we did have to wait a bit even though we had a reservation. It wasn't an unpleasant wait, but if you need to be somewhere just pad your time.

9WVhZetJKOMmLu6stN14IQ.text: My sister-in-law and I are foodies so we were naturally drawn to Beauty & Essex after seeing an article in Eater. I made reservations via OpenTable for a Wednesday evening and off we met in Vegas with our plus ones (my husband and her friend). You enter through a pawn shop into a dimly lit speakeasy. The menu is tapas style and all of the plates are meant for sharing. Drinks are strong and the service was friendly and attentive. FYI, the bathroom is located outside of the restaurant and doesn't follow NYC's "champagne served in the women's restroom" trend, wah! Memorable plates: * Yellowtail sashimi * Tuna poke wonton tacos * Grilled cheese, smoked bacon & tomato soup dumplings * Elote style scallops * Ice cream and sorbet selection (housemade daily, flavors vary but all of the ones we had were the bomb.com!) Just "A-OK": * Cauliflower (but it's hard to mess that up!) The next time I dine here, I would pass on: * Short rib mac & cheese (way too salty!) * Oven braised chicken meatballs (the texture was odd) Overall, I had a good dining experience here. It's one of the more fun and less "stuffy" dining spots inside the Cosmo, and I definitely would come back again.

The staff is so sweet (shout-out to Markie!!! Go visit her). And the free champagne bar outside? Who can complain!  Ps: order the chicken meatballs and a Tomato soup grilled cheese dumplings

5s8UfpQRJS5pw92-J-1wrw.text: This restaurant is both delicious and has amazing ambiance. The food is great and the location is legit t.  Classy AF love love love   Bonus it plays great music!  Highly recommend

819kqt7CwBUZn7SBpc_wjw.text: Fun spot and atmosphere, decent service, average menu with some things being phenomenal and others being boring and over priced.  Worth one visit but I feel no need to return per se.

IkyU5e2njwte5idohNqklw.text: Food-- disappointing dish after disappointing dish. Overcooked steak: I asked for medium. I got almost well done. This was disappointing. Even left a few pieces behind....   French onion soup dumplings: Served at room temp (barely warm), so the cheese wasn't  ooey or gooey.  Short rib Mac and Cheese: the mac and cheese tasted good but there were tiniest morsels of short rib that you could barely see or taste.   Ambience--not nearly as glamorous or stunning as the one LES. Not even close.  Also, the free champagne bar is outside of the restaurant, which is kind of weird, logistically speaking. Even weirder than a bar in a bathroom!       Drinks--Cocktail list is almost identical to the one in the LES. Drinks here are pricey and strong. Sadly, I couldn't finish my second drink, but since we are in Vegas they poured it into a "to go" cup for me.    Service-- the bartender was efficient and the server was extra bubbly. It's unfortunate the food was so bad.    Final verdict: I came here hoping I would have the same great experience as the The B&E in NY but the Lower East Side location is better than the Vegas location in all aspects.
