1DR4reKz0n1TdJlnLSfqDQ.text: Everything was great! The atmosphere is dark, sexy and fun. They play great music and the staff was very sweet. We started with K-Town Bao Burgers and Grilled Cheese & Tomato Soup Dumplings. They were amazing! We actually ordered more burgers because they were so delicious. The bao bun is harder than usual and super sweet, with a sauce on the burger. The grilled cheese was amazing and it's such a creative dish.   We were there for my boyfriend's birthday, so they brought out doughnuts for dessert. They come with three different dipping sauces but they are yummy without!   Overall this is a great restaurant and I've already started telling people they HAVE to try it!

pHd1-ltrwvEl6-piukSRoA.text: Had a great experience at the Las Vegas location. We were seated for our reservation on time. We didn't have to wait long for our food. Drinks were good too. What really stole the show was our server Candyce. She was attentive, energetic, and bubbly. She even acknowledged my anniversary with my fave dessert. She exceeded expectations.

32a9qtQo-s7W8taL96iWjw.text: Yummmmm!!!!!!   Made a reservation for my birthday dinner celebration. Our dinner was at 9:45 pm. We arrived on time and checked in with the hostess where she asked who's bday it was (mine!!). She said the table was getting ready so my friend and I went to the bar to grab a drinks (we both ordered the bubbles and berries- V good). About 15 minutes later our table was ready. The table we were sat at was a nightmare. I kept getting bumped and requested that we be moved (which was no big deal and was taken care of immediately).   When we moved the new waitress came over introduced herself and discussed the menu. Since we had a late lunch we didn't order too much but the waitress guided us through what to order. I was bummed we couldn't order more.   Food:  Tuna poke tacos- AMAZING!  Peach and buratta toast- was not a fan. I would suggest skipping it.  GRILLED CHEESE, SMOKED BACON & TOMATO SOUP DUMPLING- so good!!!   Our waitress kept checking in on us, but it felt more like we were being rushed. We enjoyed our food ordered and sipped on a few more drinks but it seemed like she just wanted us to keep it moving.   I was also a bit bummed that nothing was done for my bday since it was mentioned a few times. Overall the food was delicious, the atmosphere was cool but I was not a fan of the service

r2x2b4PoagETigE4_tg4Cg.text: We were pretty excited to go here, but it was just average. We ordered the Grilled cheese bites, Mac and cheese, Thai Shrimp, Korean chicken. 3vsqJWeYic_AfsDDKsNojQ.text: This place was my favorite for this trip I was on. Beauty and Essex is in Cosmopolitan.  I had been wanting to go based off another friend's IG post. I went in knowing exactly what I wanted. I was ready for the Mexican Street Corn Ravioli. I barely looked at the menu past that because I wasn't changing my mind. When we first sat down we were told that it was tapas style and to order 5-7 things for the two of us. That didn't work for my budget though so I started with only the ravioli and decided I would go from there. I'm glad I did because I actually didn't need anything else - other than maybe a bajillion more of those ravioli and dessert. I'm kind of joking. While I wanted to order another round of ravioli, I really was quite satisfied with the one order I received.  We also ordered the mini strawberry shortcake for dessert and they were so incredibly good. The waiter didn't recommend them, but I do. They were a nice light dessert and perfectly sweet.

n178HM1TBwYpgD-ehjNKKg.text: I loved the theme of this restaurant. Starting from the pawn shop entrance, to the swanky Sex and the City type lounge, to the even sexier dining area- this was my kind of dinner spot. Our service was great, though the food took its time..  I will say that the portions are teeeeny. At one point, my friend and I wanted to laugh at how small the ahi tuna tacos were at the price they were at. We ordered the sashimi, which was delicious. I got the salmon for my entree, and this was delicious as well though a bit overdone. My friend ordered the cavatelli, and this was quite tasty too. Our drinks- ODB were super refreshing with this meal.  For our birthdays, the waitress brought out these absolutely delicious cake pops. We boxed them up after trying one, and I proceeded to have the saved one the next night. We had a great overall dining experience before a night out in Vegas- loved it!

bPV7Qu2pMw6a-248oqyLQQ.text: Prepare your wallets and your earbuds. Beauty & Essex is a very ~Vegas~ experience. Similar to my sentiments on Vegas in general, I believe Beauty & Essex is more of a come-once-to-experience-it kind of place.   After stumbling through a very high-end jewelry/art storefront, we found the restaurant. On a Saturday night around 7:30, my friend and I had no trouble getting a table for two.  The interior is extremely hip and the place seemed huge. We were seated and were immediately surprised by how loud the place was. It was a little difficult to hold a conversation across the table because it was difficult to hear each other.  We decided to keep the meal light (after seeing the prices OUCH) and ordered some appetizers to share:   Grilled cheese, smoked bacon tomato soup dumplings:  This item seems to be a restaurant favorite, as most people had it on their table. It was, to be honest, okay. It was pretty much exactly what it sounds like, nothing quite exceptional or unique. It's also a little much for a table of two, definitely designed for larger parties.   Bao Buns: These have to be ordered one at a time. The bread to meat ratio was very off, so I ended up taking the top half of my bread off so I could get a better taste of the flavors. My bun was also extremely underdressed, compared to my friend's which seemed to have more sauce on it.   Korean fried chicken and kimchi: These bite-size chicken pieces were probably my favorite. I was worried because it was advertised to be on a bed of kimchi cucumber salad, and I am not a fan of kimchi, but the salad was extremely mild and I was able to eat the cucumbers.   Lastly, the common thread between everything we ordered which really knocked my experience down to a two star, was that EVERYTHING CAME OUT COLD! Our food arrived on the table about 2-3 minutes after we ordered. It was extremely clear that the kitchen already had the items prepared. I was extremely dissappointed to be paying top dollar for cold food...

YAHEol1f0g-4gWuuC0toog.text: we were there for a date night and unfortunately there was a large bachelorette party seated behind us. They were playing bachelorette games popping balloons and being extremely obnoxious. I am all about having a good time but I don't think this was the right setting for their type of party. It was slightly distracting and annoying for everyone else dining. They would have been better off seated in a more private room. Food was good. We had the tomahawk it was great and the grilled cheese dumplings that everyone raves about I personally thought they weren't anything worth talking about and arrived to the table cold. I definitely had better service the first time we ate there. I would say this time everything was just okay.

dbbOiucZj9C4YKzI6Eck3w.text: Came here to celebrate my boyfriend's 21st birthday and we were left full and speechless.  I had heard amazing reviews for the LA location of this restaurant so I knew this was somewhere I had to go when I went to Vegas. I made my reservation through OpenTable which was a breeze itself. All I had to do was pick the date I would be going, how many people, and they gave me time options from there. Our Vegas trip was a surprise for my boyfriend so he didn't know any of the plans I had made for us for the weekend, so walking up to the front of the restaurant (through the pawn shop) my boyfriend was very concerned and thought I had the wrong place hahaha. I had him open the door that switches us from the shop into the restaurant and his eyes lit up of amazement. Such a small little detail of the dinner but really set the tone for the night.  Our waitress was very welcoming and told us the ways of the road, she suggested to us that we order around 6-8 dishes since they are sharing plates and that's what we did. Out of everything we ordered, my favorites were the mac n cheese, grilled cheese dumplings, and the bao buns. Of those though, that mac n cheese was one of the most amazing things I have ever eaten in my life. The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente, the sauce was so rich and creamy and cheesy, and the addition of the egg on top really made it that much more decadent.  Lastly, I made a quick note in our reservation that we were going to be celebrating a birthday so at the end of our meal our waitress surprised my boyfriend with a little birthday dessert. The dessert was three flourless chocolate cake cake-pops that were I think was the best flourless chocolate cake(my fav dessert) I had ever had. Super yummy and very thoughtful, my boyfriend felt very special this evening. The overall service we received during this meal was amazing, our waters were never half full because they were always being topped off, any dirty dishes were cleared from our table the second we were finished, and everyone was just very friendly and kind as a whole. This place was such a great dining experience and it without a doubt a place everyone needs to try at least once.

CDYNPVQtDNlqIlaq1xA5yg.text: Less than enthused by the service and the food. We had to ask multiple times for food we requested that they kept forgetting. The food we did get was room temperature and we dang near had to order our drinks 2 at a time to keep them flowing. The ambience is great- the hostesses were nice and we were seated promptly. I brought 2 of my athlete clients the night we went and they weren't impressed

vlvpBafKe2VnNgwZf18P2g.text: I chose Beauty & Essex for my birthday dinner, and I was NOT disappointed. The ONLY complaint I have is that they sat a couple with a baby at the table across from us and the baby screeched and cried for the last third of our meal. (Who brings their under-one-year-old baby to an upscale restaurant in Vegas at 8 PM at night, really.)  Anyway, that's not really the restaurant's fault, and before the screeching child, I did love the ambiance. (The fact that you enter through a[n upscale] pawn shop is also very cool.)  We were a group of four and in the end each shelled out just under $100 for 2-3 drinks each and more than enough to eat. My favorites were the grilled cheese and tomato soup dumplings and the mac-and-cheese, though all of the dishes I tried were awesome as well, and they brought me truffles for my birthday, which was also a plus :) There were definitely a few menu items that I didn't get to try, too, so I'm definitely planning on going back next time I'm in Vegas.

RYKShYg2U24sY-1Jthw5yw.text: Absolutely my favorite place to go to. Situated in the cosmopolitan, its SUCH a neat speakeasy experience! Food and drinks were absolutely on point. Service was incredible. Honestly, I don't know how else to describe this place other than perfection. The scene was vibrant, seductive, yet classy and chic. A MUST to go to if you're in Vegas.

GRuhcubo7fPV4F7SfwR7zg.text: I've been dying to try this place out forever, I've heard all the hype about it and how cool it is and it defiantly played up to its reputation! This is on the third floor of the cosmopolitan, directly off the elevators!   The prices are very expensive, and the portions are average to small. As long as you know what you are getting into and wanting to splurge a little, this place is 10/10. It is a dark atmosphere so it was a little hard to read the menu.   I got the beauty tonic cocktail, it was a little strong from my liking but it was well made. For eats, I got the herb chicken and the Asian chicken dumplings! Defiantly recommend these dumplings they were amazing!!   As a local though, I would not go here again just every weekend UNLESS I had the reason to have a fancy night out. I would recommend it that you must try this place out though since you can't beat the fun atmosphere and vibe. And well who doesn't want to go to a place where you enter in a guitar shop at first?!?

nqyXDosU-Ugt4csjNsXD1w.text: Great atmosphere and decor! Food.....not so much. We found out that the menu changes every month so don't go expecting something cause it ain't there. Servings are extra small especially for the price. I would not go back or recommend it.

snwxKoDiDouYUjAUdoxj9w.text: Beautifully decorated speak easy feel. The drinks were creative and flavorful. The food was good...tapas type , for sharing. We liked everything we ordered, esp the Lobster Roll... A bit on the noisy side  due to many larger groups, probably conventions.

qYSpVtpbscgxq0YgBm-GHA.text: Beauty & Essex is one of those cool spots in Vegas that is fun for a nice dinner before a night out, a date night, etc. I love the concept that was carried over from the original spot in New York where you find the restaurant after going through a discreet pawn shop to a dark, sultry restaurant. The food is also excellent, and I was able to try their famed grilled cheese and tomato soup dumplings (not to be missed), the poke wonton tacos, and other shared items. A fun experience overall!.

0zB8jFH5KdmfusX1ldQmsA.text: Amazing new place @ LV! Vibrant ambience, brilliant menu. Bravo Chef Santos! Coming back, gr8 experience, our server was awesome.

yfG6lGrI_a96Xgub8-S5Nw.text: Everything was amazing but it was extremely noisy to the point we couldn't really hold a conversation. Price was very reasonable for the meal though compared to other Vegas restaurants and the decor was very cute.

ZVkSnuWfhMOyQWvqeAprBA.text: I had no idea where we were going--not just because of the pre-party cocktails, but because we entered a pawn shop?? Lol The restaurant entrance is through the pawn shop (which is so cool)! The lounge seemed like an easy choice since it was Friday night and we had no reservation.  Our party of six enjoyed cocktails and fantastic music from the dj! (Thank you for playing every request!) We ordered lots of appetizers--sliders, flatbread, grilled cheese/tomato soup, wedge salad, etc.  All were delicious!!! Everything was flowing nicely and the apps came out evenly spaced...other than the sliders.  We watched plates upon plates of sliders go by to other tables.  After what seemed like too long, I gingerly asked if they were coming and was assured they were on their way.  70 minutes after ordering, I finally had to go ask the very nice manager who shared my concern.  Obviously there had been a mistake, but 70 minutes is just too long.  They came out, but just plain and simply too late.  The manager took them off the bill without even having to ask and honestly, we still left happy! My only comment to the darling waitress: just tell us that a mistake happened.  We would've ordered something else.  Otherwise, a fabulous place and I can't wait to go back (and I won't order the sliders!). Lol

mQ8-xl0X2BMpk5xXj-m1jw.text: The food and beverage - fantastic. Really cool entrance, and a speakeasy feel in the restaurant. The reason I'm giving 4 stars is because of the dim lighting and extremely loud atmosphere. Otherwise, I enjoyed It!

h94-zowMqQ5BQTrjsunmSA.text: The food is excellent, no doubt about it. I found it very expensive, which I should expect in Vegas. Highlights of the meal included the shrimp and the grilled cheese dumplings. Didn't have dessert.

O9DQW_-2_h7WtJltHFq0cA.text: What's the point of a reservation when you still have to wait 15-20 minutes? Well the grilled cheese, bacon and tomato soup dumplings were worth it!!! The mac n'cheese with short rib was not nearly as good as it sounds or should be, which can also be said for ravioli. Fun atmosphere but a little loud and dark. Customer service was amazing!!! Worth a visit!!

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ApiAR6fGA9OQ1rquM5cbwA.text: My friends and I were staying at the Cosmo and were having a sweet tooth after dinner.  We had to ask the concierge and she suggested Beauty & Essex.  We finally found it on the 2nd floor of cosmo, in a pawn shop, just like a speakeasy.  The desserts were delicious.  I really like the Kygo one (since he's one of my fav. DJs).  Also, we had a very attentative waitress.  Overall great vibes, desserts, and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kygo Cloud Nine Dessert

6NX2ZgsWrJnHrB5Nj061EQ.text: I have found my new favorite dining experience in Las Vegas, and it is in Beauty & Essex.  You can see the bright yellow sign from the strip off the third floor of the Cosmopolitan, but what you'll find on the inside is culinary genius.  If tapas is your game, then Beauty & Essex is your place!  From the array of photos below, you can see that plates are small but shareable to the extreme.  We split about 9ish dishes between the 4 of us, 2 desserts and 2 rounds of drinks.  Needless to say, we ran up a hefty tab but it's the price you pay for amazing food and drink.  Let's break it down with food first: -Tuna Poke Wonton Tacos -- probably my favorite of the tapas we had.  Cute little wonton tacos with fresh ahi tuna poke inside and a drizzle of wasabi kewpie on top.  Packed with flavor and a nice little punch -East & West Coast Oysters -- I forgot the "East Coast" ones but the West Coast oysters were the kumamotos (my fave), so needless to say they were good.  There was a mignonette served with it but it was too icy for my liking. -Greek Toast -- one of the simplist dishes we had, but super tasty.  Usually comes in a serving of 3 pieces, but our waiter was nice enough to get 4 so everyone could try.  Fresh veggies and flavors piled on and easy to eat -"Chile Relleno" Empanadas -- kinda heavy on the cheese, but I love me some Manchego so I didn't mind all too much!  I wish there was a tad bit more jalapeno-lime crema on top, but the tiny dot was enough to get the idea of the flavor -Grilled Cheese, Smoked Bacon & Tomato Soup Dumplings -- We almost didn't order these, but I'm really glad we did!!!  The waiter suggested one of the dumplings no matter what, so we opted for this.  Served on spoon, the tomato soup isn't piping hot making it easy to eat.  The culimination of all your favorite things into one spoon-sized bite was incredible. -Roasted Mushroom Pizzetta -- a very very safe choice for something with great flavors.  Wish it was a tad bit crispier but otherwise very tasy.  Very easy to share and even if you eat like a bird, enough for one person to have. -Pressed Jerk-Spiced Chicken -- probably my least favorite dish.  Not because it was bad but because jerk spice is not my favorite thing.  I'd probably opt for the meatballs next time. -Crispy Vidalia Onion Rings -- don't care for onion rings, but these were bomb!!  The sambal ketchup makes them oh so tasty!  They are huge and super filling too. -Grilled Double Cut Lamb Chops -- I had a bite out of this because the guys got it to share.  Tender and pink, the medium rare lamb chops were tasty with a nice glaze on top. -Black Bottomed Butterscotch Pot de Creme -KYGO Cloud Nine "S'mores" -- The desserts were honestly larger than any of the tapas.  The S'mores was a little too sweet for my liking but the marshmallow whip on top was delectable!!  Now for drinks: -Earl the Pearl -- a super strong tea taste to this one, so if tea is not up your alley don't bother.  I thought it was a good drink to have while you were eating because of all the subtleties to avoid washing out the flavor of the foods. -Bubbles & Berries -- if you're into more sweet this is for you.  At first it seems a little intimidating (champagne, vodka AND st. germain) but it's not as strong as you'd think.  Loved having it after our meal as something sweet on my palette.  SO.  If the menu doesn't win you over, I hope this does.  It doesn't hurt that the staff is AMAZING and the restaurant itself is gorgeous. Just do yourself a favor and eat here.

JZBDBic2Qw0JaOe4Yy8UsQ.text: Beauty & Essex was the best meal I had in Vegas on this trip. The food was amazing. Some standout dishes were the burrata toast, chicken meatballs, and the pork belly. The cocktails cost $17 which is average for a nice place in Vegas. Ordering was difficult since the waitress told us to order 2-3 small plates per person at the table and it was WAY too much food. Very difficult ordering with a group of 7 people. Cost came out to about $75 per person which was fair for the food we received. The best thing about this place is the ambience of the entire restaurant and pawn shop as you enter.

olrgfXDvGVpf7YS3xd0KaA.text: Everything we ate was amazing!!! The waiter was very helpful while we were trying to decide. He explained what everything was and what went best together. The grilled cheese dumplings and tomato soup was my absolute favorite.

uFkWYgJANU9vpdqZl3XRZA.text: Had to wait 30 minutes for my reservation. The environment is tacky; filled with gaudy crystals and golden peacocks on the wall. Extremely loud environment and the waiters whisper to you. Do not recommend. Our waiter was uneducated and couldn't hold a conversation. They say every dish takes "40 minutes to cook". Absolutely terrible experience.

aP6dcLXE9161NRr_svfWfw.text: The food at this place is freaking phenomenal!  Every single thing they brought to our table was not just great, but shockingly good. Like you have to swear when you eat it because it is so good.  It is quite expensive, but so is everything else in Vegas and the food here was worth it.

ioT0PBk5P_EjGm3RZiMV4w.text: By far one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. The uniqueness of this place is so special. The pawn shop entrance and the restaurant decor is super cool. It's dark, moody, and loud in there. My grandma would hate it, but I loved it! The dj was playing great music.   The drinks were very good. Our sever was attentive and we felt taken care of the entire time. Water glasses were always full, our plates taken almost immediately. We used our identity card to pay for the meal as a comp, and the server took care of everything, no confusion what so ever.   I cannot wait to return to this place! The food was outstanding and the service top notch.

2_zT77DDLTImLt6S8UZ-jA.text: I need to admit that I am NOT the demographic this place is appealing to. On first impression the outside looks like a guitar/jewelry/pawn shop. Step inside and it morphs into a crowded,dark, ultra trendy..very noisy restaurant. A romantic dining experience it is not. no Tony Bennett music in the background. They obviously know their clientele....its super packed on a Wednesday night! Cocktails are very good. My Manhattan Lemon was delicious and potent. Its all about tapas here.Food is to be shared. Small plates of mac and cheese, short ribs...grilled cheese bacon tomato soup dumplings..roast mushroom pizzetta...mexican street corn ravioli and molasses glazed pork belly. Myself and my wife as well as my two adult children enjoyed the food..all very tasty. I honestly believe our waitress(who was very good)...seemed intent on jacking up our bill. she had lots of food suggestions. portions are small,but pricey. I just think Beauty and Essex tries way too hard to be cool. Hipster hangout!

hI1JoBzm4uVdeORGS9SImw.text: I came here for a business dinner while I was in town for a convention and I must say that was I was a little disappointed with my Vegas experience.  I have been to the New York location and loved it and the Vegas spot just doesn't quite hold up.    We were a little late for our reservation so I called ahead of time and made it within our 15 minute grace period.  I understand that it is busy and that we were late.  However - we were obviously being hustled out of there by our waitstaff.  We ordered drinks, and tried a number of different items on the menu.  We had the Thai Shrimp and the Scallops and they both had the exact same slaw underneath them which was a little disappointing as the flavors were exactly the same.  We also tried the onion rings which were exactly what you'd expect and had the double barrelled pork chop which the sauce on top was bitter and acidic.    Overall the menu was a little hard to order as things aren't really in a certain style or theme.  The meal was just not very cohesive and easy to put together things that went well together.    The waitress at the end of the meal basically said do you even want anything off of the dessert menu?  Never offered another drink or coffee...we were in and out in under an hour.  It was not a relaxing or comfortable dinner.

8ZJeY4looic1YTcQcHOqIQ.text: B&E had me sold as soon as I was led through a "secret" entrance through their pawn shop.  Whaaa? A pawn shop in luxurious Cosmopolitan hotel? That's right, who knew! I've walked by their facade countless times but never once thought that beyond the displays of jewelry, purses, guitars that there's a hidden restaurant inside. Quite cool I'd say. I felt very Bond-esque.  The decor is unique and it has a very mysterious lair-y vibe. Very interesting. But let's move on to the food!  I love tapas! It's the main reason I'm going to Spain soon. I travel for food! But I digress. I started with littleneck clams on the half shell. Although I prefer my oysters my SO thoroughly loved it and he hates oysters. So it's up to your preference I guess. Next we had the grilled cheese dumplings served on individual soup spoons laying atop flavorful tomato soup! It's just as delicious as it looks. My favorite dish of the night happens to be the Tomato Tartare. Now it's interesting because tartares are usually made of meat but in this case, it's just the good 'ol tomatoes. I admit I got it because the pics looked beautiful. Don't judge me! I expected to hate it then pass it on to my SO to finish (hehehe) but I fell in love with it instead. It was packed full of flavor and very pretty to look at as well. It also looked more like beef tartare in person!  We ended with some Reverse S'mores Bites which was perfect. My favorite part of the s'mores was the meringue. So gooey... yum! 10/10 would dine here again.

c8d2lWCSBcEEv7Ej1IoERA.text: I can't think of a restaurant more deserving of 5 stars. Great ambiance,interesting cocktails, reasonable prices for the quality.   My wife and I had:  Oysters - delicious toppings   Caviar - delicious and interesting service with the whipped butter  Grilled cheese tomato soup appetizer - lived up to the hype  Tuna tartare tacos - delicious  Spanish/Mexican raviolis - very good, very rich  Rainbow carrots with curry - OMG possible the best dish we had!  Peanut butter dessert - unbelievable rich but soooo good

0QogmDGNr8lPR96e3xuHZg.text: My wife and I have eaten here several times. One of the many amazing restaurants at the Cosmopolitan of Las Vegas.   However, tonight this restaurant went above and beyond to help us do something nice for our friends. Brianna Glantz is the person who helped us and represents the pure essence of premium service.   The food is A. She, and the team, are A plus.

wPcuEdFT8Ftaqwzr4hWbAg.text: A little dark for my taste, but loved the ceviche and mushroom flatbread for starters. Moved onto the grill cheese dumplings, tomatoes soup and the chicken meatballs and fell in love. Had the side car with pear puree to top it off. Thanks for the experience. Can't complain about the food one bit, but the verdict  is still out on the service....We shall see...

2Q-UYcCvIoXqIIXHK1lr3g.text: Food was very good, but there just wasn't much of it. We all left very hungry. If you're going for a very light dinner this is the place. Drinks were delicious as well. I also thought it was overpriced for the amount of food you get. The atmosphere was awesome though. Our waiter Apollo seemed a little scatter brained. He brought us two orders of empanadas when we only ordered one. We ate them anyway because we were starving lol... also kept asking weird questions about our order we already told him. Maybe lack of sleep.

oCsi8lqX49G_qOuGkgWNLw.text: OK the first time I came here the service was really really horrible. It was extremely busy they pretty much kept giving me bacon and I don't eat bacon after 3 times. The management really hooked it up and gave us a free dinner I believe I can't recall exactly but they really did take care of us. But at the end of the day it's kind of annoying when you can't eat your meal---but they totally made it up to us. I really loved this place on second and third try,  food is great I love their tuna tacos and salads!  Great atmosphere-- great for a date and also it's good to have a birthday here, or just have friends there for a small party. I would recommend just getting a seat closer to the middle dining area and enjoying The busy atmosphere of it all. I can't wait to come back! Great tip is that on Mondays they have Key night  so they have two-for-one drinks I believe :-)

x-WgZfVohgFuL7zF6bUk3w.text: My husband and I celebrated our 5 year anniversary here. The ambiance from the beginning is relaxing and laid back. Although the bar is a little small, we were able to snag 2 seats and have a couple cocktails before our dinner. They were a bit pricey, but that's to be expected at the Cosmo. The small plates were creative and surprisingly filling. We left there very happy and full!

5VF21lUAbDPYilXjmOHcvg.text: d...a...r...k... and LLOOUUDD! Oh wait, didn't hear you... it's too LLOOUUDD in here! Can't tell what to order because its too dark and I can't see.  You enter through a pawnshop and once your eyes adjust to the darkness, you can see that this place is beautiful in an illicit sort-of way, dark, intimate, and sexy.  No doubt there's a lot of footsie going on under the tables here, and if you think about it, after a couple of the excellent cocktails, you'll be doing it too for sure.  There are imaginative cocktails and the menu is filled with items to be shared.  The chef's favorites are pulled together as a single prix-fixe meal - for simplicity, and because we couldn't hear the waiter (too loud) or read the menu (too dark), we chose that option.    In general the food was quite good.  Portions were adequate and we did not leave the restaurant hungry.

cWA2ici_78UzzOBgThvl-g.text: Great place for large groups and lots of sharing options.  We had a party of 14 and the service was top notch.  Food was great with lots of options for all.  We went tapas style and shared plates and appetizers.  It looks like a pawn shop in the front and you enter the back for the restaurant.  Recommend for large groups as it's affordable and they can accommodate.

7ENouyHsMf6Cz10J6UlhbQ.text: I seriously loved everything about this place. It was beautiful and it had a lively vibe to it. Yes it's loud but honestly your in Vegas + at the cosmopolitan so it's expected!  We called a couple of hours in advance to make a reservation for Thursday at 7:15pm. We were sat as soon as we arrived and the front desk staff acknowledged that it was my husbands birthday. Which was sweet since they all wished him a happy birthday. They sat us in a spacious booth. Our waiter Frank was super super attentive and knowledgeable. Our glasses were never empty and our food arrived fairly quickly. We ordered the Cesar toast, k town bao burgers, grilled cheese smoked bacon dumplings, Mediterranean cauliflower and the chicken meatballs and it was SO delish!! The bill was 115 minus tip which is nothing for two people that ordered that much + we had a few virgin drinks that were amazing as well. All in all I would definitely love to come back!

rQzNUt42fmkVjlOxBqdq5Q.text: From the ambiance to the staff to the actual food, the entire experience was amazing. A bit on the pricey side, but it's sure worth it for a date night or a tourist spot.  When you first see the restaurant, you might get a little confused. The front of the restaurant is a pawn/jewelry shop of sorts that make you question if you are at the right place. You entire this shop and there is a door in the back (which looks like an employee entrance) that leads to the main restaurant. The restaurant is dimly lit with different shaped mirrors all around the walls; it has the ambiance of an old-time European royal's mansion.   We started off the night with drinks. I had a Ruby Iced Tea, a virgin cocktail, which was highly refreshing. The red currant tea was flavorful and the lemon juice gave it the hint of acidity that the drink needed. The mint leaves also gave the drink it the refreshing kick it needed, especially with the weather being over 100 degrees outside.  Most of the plates here are served tapas style, so our table of four got a total of 7 plates and 2 desserts. To start the night off, we had a half dozen East and West Coast Oysters. The oysters may have been small in size, but they were fresh. Next, the Steak Toast came out. This had a slight kick to it from the serrano pepper. The steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare, allowing it to be juicy. It was lightly seasoned, allowing the Malaysian spices to be the star.   As the night went on, we had Grilled Double Cut Lamb Chops, Short Rib Mac & Cheese, and Roasted Mushroom Pizzetta. The lamb chops were also medium rare and was very tender and juicy. It  had a delicious wine glaze and was served over creamy grits. The lamb cut like butter and was flavorful on its own, but the glaze accentuated the natural flavors of the lamb. The grits gave a different texture to the dish, which it needed. The Mac & Cheese was delicious; though it was not the best I've ever had, it was still good. It was filled with chunks of short rib, not just small, thin shreds, which was impressive. The Mac & Cheese tasted like it was made of a Parmesan base, with hints of truffle oil. With the creaminess of the Mac & Cheese, the cornbread crust that topped it gave it a different texture that the dish needed. The Mushroom Pizzetta was also very tasty; the crust had a nice crunch with juicy mushrooms that topped it.  After these 5 dishes, we were still hungry, so we got BBQ fries and Garganelli. These two dishes were both mediocre. The fries were heavily seasoned, making it hard to eat many of them at the same time. The Garganelli's sauce was very rich and sweet; and though I like meat sauces, this sauce had too much meat since it felt like there was more meat than pasta.   To finish the night off, we had "les nyc" Doughnuts, which were fried perfectly and not too sweet. It came with caramel, chocolate, and berry sauces. The caramel and chocolate sauces were good and very rich and sweet, while the berry was lighter and did not overpower the flavors of the doughnut. We also had the Root Beer Shots, which was dangerously good because it tasted like a regular root beer float.  All in all, the entire experience was amazing. Though some of the foods had some short comings, most of the food we ate were delicious.

r8GYtzhghbp-BDlY2ghupA.text: Good addition to the Cosmo. I always wanted to try this place out and was excited to hear that they've opened a location in Vegas.   I loved the sleek and sexy decor, but not sure if a "speakeasy" theme and a pawn shop fits into a Vegas casino like Cosmo. Nonetheless, their cocktails were excellent and our waitress was attentive.  Perhaps I'll give this place another chance, but Rose. Rabbit. Lie still remains as my favorite bar at the Cosmo.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basil Hayden&#39;s Bourbon &amp; The Garrison
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocktail menu

0j7BA8iVyCv1yiDJ_sqe7g.text: This spot is a must! My girlfriends and I got a Vip table during Monday night prior marquee night club. They laced the table with an assortment of different finger foods and top grade drinks.   The meal started off with a few glasses of champagne. Then they served us our favorite vodka mixed drinks. After the drink service, the food started pouring in. The first thing on the menu was a freshly prepared Cobb salad. The salad was loaded with fresh mixed greens and delicious rustic flavors. Once I was done with my salad, they served me a chicken parmesan flatbread. The chicken was crispy and the flatbread was laced with a flavorful tomato sauce. Then came tuna tar tar tacos. The tacos were loaded with a mix of flavors. It was sweet and salty. The soy sauce added a bitter yet salty kick. The crunchy taco shell was glazed with a sweet coating. The meal ended with jumbo glazed shrimp. The shrimp was so fresh and lacked all fishy smell. I do want to mention that the food we selected was super girly and made the girls night out even more girly and sexy than we anticipated.   The service was fast, professional and intimate. I highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for great food and great music.   When I went Timmy trumpet graced us with his music and presence. His musical talent was radiating throughout the whole restaurant. He let off great vibes!   May I add, before you enter the hidden door leading to the actual restaurant, you walk into a classy pawn shop displaying beautiful pieces of jewelry and gizmos and gadgets.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb salad
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table bottle service

PYkwfh0TWrLIlnyxRQbcpw.text: The low score is strictly food based. The service, ambience, and uniqueness of the restaurant were excellent. You almost feel like you're walking into a pawn shop when you first walk in, but then you walk through this section and end up in a vibrant bar area. The restaurant area is past the bar. The environment is definitely Vegas like, with music and just the right amount of lighting. People were dressed up and the vibe was very hip and upscale.   We had reservations and were sat down at our table right away at 8pm on a Friday night. The server and assisting staff were extremely courteous, professional, and attentive. The service was truly excellent.     The food was an entirely different experience though. My wife and I both had the filet, along with a cauliflower dish and a broccoli dish. You literally could not taste the actual food itself because everything was completely over seasoned.   What they did to the filet was borderline criminal. It had this thick barbecue seasoning rub all over it, like what you might to do a brisket before smoking it for three hours. Except the filet was grilled, causing this barbecue rub to caramelize. The flavor was overwhelming, and not in a good way. They also sliced the filet before serving it, causing all the juices to flow out before it even hit my plate. What was served were slices of dry meat that tasted like over seasoned barbecue potato chips. This is not an exaggeration at all.   The same thing with both the cauliflower and broccoli. The cauliflower also had a thick seasoning poured all over it, completely masking the natural flavor of the vegetable and leaving your mouth dry. The broccoli tasted like the chef tried to pour salt on it, but the lid came off and the entire container of salt fell all over it. It was truly perplexing why they felt the need to put such an incredible amount of seasoning on everything.   My wife and I had been to Vegas several times before, but we were there with my brother and his wife, and this was their first night ever in Vegas. We felt bad that this was their first dining experience.

AAsT47-Zh0bpedSgr3k-SA.text: Loved the decor and ambience. Unfortunately what should have been a fully immersive dining experience was extremely disappointing. We were quite literally rushed through our beverages and small plates with little to no opportunity to enjoy or savor. We had 7pm reservations and were paid in full ($250) by 8:10pm.   While we enjoyed the first plate, the subsequent plates came in such rapid fashion that many got cold and tasteless. When I told our server, he wasn't prepared to handle the complaint. He sent over a floor manager who seemed equally ill-equipped to handle. Quite honestly it was a bummer...we were really excited!  With so much competition, there are just too many options to settle for mediocre.

4htEHWyUTurPUJ6yzyUjCg.text: My wife suggested this place as they are known for small plates and sharing! Really hip ambience and the service was great. They have a bone marrow dish and bruschetta dishes that are top notch. I would recommend the lamb chops as the demi glace was the best! Great experience for having some cocktails and sharing some food.

sGTD_diEwkdAA8TknDWxBA.text: This was a truly great experience.  We came here with a party of 4 and shared about 6-7 plates and ALL of them were fantastic.  The ones that really stood out were the sashimi and the tuna tar tar tacos.  Our server was incredibly attentive and very friendly.  We were incredibly happy with the food and service.  The ambiance is really cool too.  This is a must try.  It's fun and tasty and doesn't leave you feeling completely gross and bloated.  I couldn't recommend this place more.

XLkK09NWzb7uUqGTn14XWQ.text: Swanky, delicious food and a great staff make for an amazing evening for groups. While I wouldn't recommend this as a date spot (the atmosphere is loud with great music), again, it is perfect for a group to celebrate any special event, or a great pre or post event spot. There is a great tasting menu; items include an exquisite choice of oysters, dumplings, mini artesian tacos and raviolis, and great individual dishes. The food is so rich and delicious! We came here before a Duran Duran concert, and the entire evening was wonderful!

QeLBtsIPqesdv0Xxx83Djw.text: I love finding new restaurants on my travel adventures. When in Las Vegas, I had some down time by myself & stumbled upon this place. Actually saw it listed on a hotel marquee, checked out the menu, made reservations,  and walked in. This place was breath taking. Upon walking in I was greeted by 2 ladies in what appeared to be a pawn shop atmosphere. The checkered floor enhanced the ecclectic decor which included pendants, knick knacks, and guitars on the wall. This definitely seemed to be a fun place to eat. When I was ushered through the door to enter the restaurant... I was blown away!!! Once inside a beautiful hostess counter was noticed with  beautiful mirrors & fresh flowers. All I could do was simply smile. This was not casual dining but a fine dining experience for sure. The host ushered me down a hallway filled with antique mirrors as I noticed the glimmering chandeliers in the dining area.  Well after being seated and taking it all in, a server came over and was clearly knowledgeable about the menu. While I was hungry, but not famished, I only wanted a light meal. My server suggested I try the grilled cheese, smoked bacon, and tomato dumplings. While I am not a grilled cheese fan, this dish was heavenly! The dish was served with bacon wrapped around the grilled cheese & tomato dumpling! The perfect blend of savory with a hint of salty had my taste buds dancing. This dish was served on 4 spoons which were beautifully placed on a rectangular dish. Next I had the Thai style deep fried shrimp served with a mango slaw. The shrimp were cooked to perfection & the sauce it was served with was a great combination of spicy & sweet.  This hidden gem was a great find & awesome experience! When in Vegas if you want your tastebuds to be tantalized as you experience a foodie's delight... look no further!

JqSMXx4ykMonGpet2Upq5w.text: I am a fine yelp reviewer with discerning, critical and poignant reviews. I hold dear my ability to deliver a fair description of the experience as i see fit.  So...  For the first time in the history of ever, im giving this place 5 stars.  -presentation : pulled "speak easy" off perfectly. 100  - food: amazing concept with tapas style courses, really awesome 100  -drinks: really cool variations and flavors 100  Nice hip hop/beat soundtrack didnt hurt.100  A home run.

rV928yPzgnSZtD_kBz2-2Q.text: I have been to the original B & E in NYC at least 7 times so have something to compare to. It was not like the original, in short I will say this felt like a fake version of the real deal in New York made to fill the masses that pour through the door for the "experience". Quantity over quality for sure.    From the outside yes, it does look impressive and the inside has a somewhat similar vibe aesthetically speaking, thats it. The food was a far cry from the original, it was unsatisfying, cheap, tasteless and poorly executed with the experience going no further than a "nice" appearance. I feel terrible to say this but the food quality was a dressed up version of I HOP, if not even worse. If you want to know why keep reading why 4 people (2 from New York  and 2 from San Diego) left with more than 50% food on their plates after paying a $400 bill.   My husband and I ordered 1 porkchop entree and 24 oz bone in steak.  For sides we had the mac N cheese, bone marrow shots, and shishito peppers.   Friends Ordered steak, scallops and mac N cheese.    The food:  1. My steak was large, the portion is huge it is. They cooked it well I asked for medium but the meat was not good quality. It felt like i kept chewing and chewing and just never chewed it out. I spat the majority out in my napkin because it was too tough to swallow.  2. My husband said the same of his pork chop, it was undercooked and the meat was chewy, he isn't a complainer as I am not either so we ate the majority left unsatisfied.  3. We shared the mac N cheese, which everyone at the table had the same thing to say, you can make a better KRAFT box at home.  It was not el dente and felt a bit undercooked, which is not as big of a problem as it was lacking flavor.  I love carbs and rarely "splurge" on them but it was not cheesy it wasn't creamy it was somewhat dry with some sort of crumbs on the top. Literally took 2-3 bites and was done. 2 dishes were left almost untouched by all 4 of us. Disappointment.  4. My friends steak came cold, literally, i touched it. He ordered medium like me and it was not even room temperature.  He waited 10 mins for replacement and had to watch us all eat.  Not fun.  5. We ordered the Marrow appies, those were amazing, amazing! you get 3 and a lot so definitely recommend, especially with a whiskey shot but my husband asked for extra crispy bread because so little came with it, they said ok and no bread ever arrived. Annoying. 6. Drinks, they were O K, mixed review. I thought the cheap celery salt added to the mezcal drink was not good. It destroyed the flavor of a good cocktail. if you order it, ask for no celery salt, it devalues the drink. 7. The shishito peppers, you get a lot, but again like the rest of the food it lacked flavor. They were cooked well the texture was good but the flavor was just off. It could have been a little savory or sour? adding something to take it to the next level, but they tasted BLAH. Another dish we did not finish.  Atmosphere  This is Vegas, which of course doesn't disappoint so definitely amazing dark vibe, decoration is nice (again not as good as NY), great place to grab a drink at the beginning at the bar, and then dine in the back afterwards. Great place for a date or to start your night in terms of vibe and getting you in the mood.   In the end we were very unsatisfied, and felt cheated and robbed walking away.  I was embarrassed to have recommended this as the IT place to dine (given my previous experience, you can refer to my review at the NY location)   TO BEAUTY AND ESSEX MANAGEMENT: if you message me that you have made changes because of my review I will update it that I have been messaged and my complaints have been actioned in fairness.

gNcukEyh8mZymkI9f5yYEg.text: I came here last night with a group of 5 for my friend's birthday. We had reservations, but our table was not yet ready when we arrived. So we sat in the lounge waiting for the pager to vibrate. After 20 minutes, one of my friends asked about the status of our table. The man at the front desk told my friend that it was still not ready, but gave us a card for a comp'd round of drinks for the table. That made the wait not a problem at all! I had the Emerald Gimlet and it was delicious! It's like drinking a refreshing green juice, and then next thing you know, you're tipsy! After the first one, we kept ordering it with added jalapenos...omg...spicy, sassy, and refreshing!  When we were sat at our table, the one problem we did have was the noise level. I don't know if it's the way the room was built or if the people dining that night were just extra loud, but it was LOUD. It was difficult to hear each other at our own table over the surrounding conversations.   Our server told us that for a group of our size, she would normally recommend about 8-10 dishes to share. We chuckled a little at this thought because we already knew we were going to surpass that number. I kid you not; we ordered just about one of every item except the oysters. My absolute favorites were the avocado toast, mushroom pizza, and Mexican corn ravioli! Everything we ordered was full of flavor and an array of textures.  To end our meal, we discreetly ordered a huge dessert platter for our friend's birthday. Our server put the candles we bought on the platter, and brought the beautiful presentation out singing. The birthday girl was pleasantly surprised. Needless to say, it was an AMAZING dinner experience!

xXkcMIGcal4WMdIjbxXB1A.text: Holy cow! Totally blown away by this place. I have seen and been lusting after the one in Hollywood but ended up going to the Vegas one first. Everything was EXCELLENT! Our server was exceptional - attentive, thoughtful, helpful, and funny. She made sure we had enough - and the right food - and made certain that our drinks came out perfectly! Everything we ate was awesome (which was almost the entire menu) but the crowd favorites were definitely the grilled cheese tomato soup dumplings and the chicken meatballs. The speakeasy ambience made it a great place to celebrate a birthday or just a fun night out! Would highly recommend and can't wait to go to the LA location

8r-2hd18WYYlD0T7jmXlww.text: Wowza.  What a place.  It's always cool to have a "hidden" restaurant behind a pen shop facade, isn't it?  The food and service it top notch and the ambience is way cool, chic fine-ish dining experience.  I'd go again in a heart beat but be sure to make reservations.  Oh, it's pricey but you're in Vegas!

oIvzZ4unpK3dHlrD9RHBJQ.text: Came here with coworkers a few weeks ago and had a great meal. Would have loved if it wasn't as dark inside as we were getting sleepy following the meal, but otherwise good ambiance.   Food: -Tomato and Creamy Burrata: I am a hugeeee burrata lover but unfortunately this was just okay. It was definitely missing something, maybe a pesto or type of sauce to brighten the dish overall  -Caesar Toast: I LOVED this- the lettuce was perfectly dressed and the crispy chicken skin crumbles elevated this completely, highly recommend -Grilled Cheese Dumplings: my coworkers felt this was the best dish of the night. I personally thought it was decent but was pretty basic flavors, nothing exceptional -Roasted Bone Marrow: I am also a huge lover of bone marrow and this was perfectly cooked. we could have easily eaten a whole plate to ourselves it was so good. definitely recommend to order- the onions, salt and parsley were perfect to brighten it up -Tomahawk Steak: I had high expectations for the steak but they weren't totally met. The steak was definitely good and medium but it wasn't as buttery or melt in your mouth as I was hoping for. the side sauces were a nice touch and added good flavor  -Tiramisu Sundae: heavily on the coffee flavors but overall well prepared

G0nf6Ng72P1NUgAhtCdgmQ.text: --IT IS WAY TOO DARK.   I get it, they want it to be an intimate dining experience, it was so dark that we had to pull out our flashlights to read the menu. Turn the lights up, just a smidge. It was so dim, it was a real buzz kill. It honestly made us so sleepy. If you're looking for a quiet place for dinner, this is not the place. It's very loud for such a dark place. The dress code: I saw every thing from jeans and tank tops to very formal wear.  The food was alright. Out of everything I ordered, The best item I tried was the Mexican corn ravioli. Tasted like elotes. Everything was served tapas style, so just order a bunch of stuff and share it.  Our waiter was very attentive which is appreciated, and they gave us stamps to get in to marquee night club for free. Over all a nice place to try our, but not a "must go eat" while in Vegas.

m1Em5sqs0VqJ6Kb0HPN7dg.text: Beauty & Essex is the type of restaurant that speaks to me - cool cocktails, an eclectic menu, a chic, swarthy vibe. And with three locations in these United States, it was only a matter of time until I got myself a seat in one. Odds, you might think, would be on their Hollywood outpost, only some 30 minutes away without LA traffic getting in the way. But over the last year and a half, when it comes to visits by me, Hollywood is losing 0-3-2 respectively to Vegas and New York (homes to the other Beauty & Essex locations). So my first B&E experience happened in the desert foodie mecca that is The Cosmopolitan in Las Vegas, a (pricey) roll of the dice that left me a winner.  You enter B&E as a customer of their pseudo pawnshop, able to purchase jewelry, guitars, or intergalactic-themed tchotchkes before (or after) dining. Skipping past the display cases, you enter into the restaurant's small lobby, speakeasy reminiscent. Once inside, you're bathed in warming hip-hop and laughter and quick conversations. A cocktail was calling my name as soon as I sat. Any of their options would've done, but I went for the Beauty Elixir, hopeful its ingredients might wash away the circles under my eyes or scrub away laugh lines. These ingredients included rose and strawberries, cucumber and gin. A sultry combination, it thrilled and delighted and relaxed, the way a Vegas cocktail should. The circles under my eyes remained.  After drinks came the arduous task of whittling down the healthy list of tapas-sized dishes I wanted to try. A big party might have helped here, a group asking for a little of everything. But with just me and hus-bae, we'd have to make some tough decisions.  Ordering a few choices I just couldn't pass up, we ended up taking home a couple boxes of vittles that just couldn't be forced down (though we did manage to sacrifice a couple bites for dessert).  At the end, I call it an exceptional dinner date, an experience I'd love to repeat when the time and pocketbook can make it happen (yes, I would have loved to call FEMA for recompense of all the damage done with my bank card). Beauty & Essex is just one of the reasons why Vegas its little Cosmopolitan gem are something lovely.  kale & apple salad - Yippee Yahoo-ey "chile relleno" empanadas - Yippee Skippy thai style deep-fried shrimp - Yay crispy vidalia onion rings - Yip Yip Hooray oven braised chicken meatballs - Yip mexican street corn ravioli - Yippee Dippy Skoo peanut butter pie sundae - Yay Yay Yay

YRIXIuonO3ucN3L5hK1MSA.text: The pawn shop front just adds to the overall stylish coolness of this place. Inside is a sleek, dark, very romantic, very hip setting.  Everything I tasted on on the new American Classics menu was prepared very well, plated beautifully and the service was very very good also.  The only caveat I'll say is the way that they have priced their menu... with various add-ons... makes for a unexpectedly expensive night out.

b409OGxBJJS0Kzq_r8mIGQ.text: The pawn shop entrance produces a really cool experience that not many restaurants replicate. Once entering through the big door (be careful for people exiting from the other side) you are embraced into a huge restaurant that appears from essentially no where. Expect a small wait but luckily the bar is located just in-front of the check in desk. Once seated the service is minimal. We got our food before our drinks. Not great. We also stated that we were in a rush too but nothing happened.   Grilled cheese dumplings were creative but a no from me. You get 8 of them so portion wise it's really great but still wasn't enough for me to say I'd order it again.   The Mexican Street Corn Ravioli was top notch, really really great!   The bao burgers were really good too! $8 is a steep price to pay per bun but they were good!   The bone marrow, tuna poke and yellowtail sashimi were all stand points as wells

8dM_zMD37hJQJuNZlNtEbg.text: Great beautiful restaurant. Drinks are yummy. Definitely a scene. Food is okay ; fancy food and expensive.  Good place to hang and splurge

C7k0UmsOwQzlogSPpWVpYA.text: Very cool concept with the restaurant disguised by the pawn shop exterior...  Beauty & Essex was truly a great experience..  We came in a party of 4. Our party ordered around 5-6 items to share as well as the 34oz Tomahawk rib-eye.   Things that blew my mind (and my taste-budssss!!!): Grilled Cheese, Smoked Bacon, Tomato soup Dumplings.. Oven Braised chicken meatballs..  We didn't think the Tomahawk was anything overly special...  When in Vegas I will definitely stop by again!!

Z1k647tE4BRhUqdCHihrqg.text: Just swung by here to grab a quick drink before we had dinner at another restaurant(Rose Rabbit Lie). Cocktails were really really good and our bartender(KC/Kasey?) was great. He was very detailed and excited about describing the cocktails to us. We told him we wanted to eat here at B &E and he said we should swing by for dessert if we still have room after dinner. Well we took his advice and came by later that evening and got the Strawberry lemon shortcake he recommended. Super good! If the rest of the staff and food is as good as we got at the bar.... I can't wait to go back for dinner.

gWaHizXZbOmA67jqJVZqzQ.text: In town for a seminar for Husband, this was my one request.  To experience B&E!  I had admired all the food pics and admired the inventive menu...could picture my five-star review.... couldn't wait for it!  Finally made it to the Cosmopolitan on Sunday night right after they opened, feeling clever that I knew to look for a pawn shop.  What I didn't know was, GO through it.  Don't expect a pawn shop employee to be helpful and tell you to go through the closed door when you say you're there for dinner. (Gal simply said "okay" when we said we were hoping to dine). Soooo...TIP: walk in the pawn shop, turn to your left and open the door.   (you're welcome!)  Fortunately we were greeted a little more warmly at the hostess stand, and brought to a small two-top just inside the dining room near the bar, which meant one of us had our back to the dining room. Not overly comfortable, especially considering the place was pretty empty. Now I'm not the most observant human being on the planet, but I couldn't help but notice one of my forks had a big glob of something clinging to it.  Pointed it out to our Server and he removed it with a "sorry", but didn't replace it.  We were fine with tap water.  Husband is a Bourbon guy, so he ordered: The Woodsman:  Woodford Reserve Bourbon, Allspice Dram, Maple Syrup, Lemon, Muddled Pears, while I went with a Cabernet.  Both were quite good, which was a good thing as we were $33 committed at this point.  Two items I wanted to try after having seen all the pics were the tomato soup dumplings and the french onion ones.  Well they aren't doing the french onion ones anymore.  Wah!   But fortunately the tomato soup ones are still on the menu. That was a no-brainer must-try for me.  Surprisingly, Husband wanted us to try the Bone Marrow.  (surprising because he doesn't eat meat on bones, so I assumed he would never want to try the inside of bones).  And the Thai Shrimp sounded really good, so we decided to start with those three.  Loved that our Server asked if we were in any hurry or if he could put the dishes in to come out one at a time.  No hurry for us.  The moment I'd been waiting for arrived...the dumplings came out first.  Beautiful presentation on the soup spoons, but... a bit hard to eat.  After awkwardly throwing a whole one in my mouth, I got smart and cut the other two with a knife.  Never did taste the smoked bacon, but they were good.  $18 good?  Maybe?   Somewhere around this point, the young guy pouring water managed to dump some in Husband's lap.  Oops.  Another "sorry".    So, the Marrow arrives, and my silverware had been cleared after the dumplings.  I had to ask for more.  All of the components worked beautifully together...the jam, salt, and teeny bit of greens.  There was just enough for the six small pieces of grilled bread.  Good, but again...$19 good?  We were still eating the marrow when the shrimp arrived. Five beautiful shrimp, lightly battered, nice Thai flavor with a small salad underneath.  Slightly spicy.  Very good, but it didn't go with the marrow (remember, no hurry and one at a time?) and for $22...well...maybe worth it?  Ready for dessert, and knowing my obsession with fried dough, Husband ordered the Doughnuts for us.  We also each got a cup of decaf.  The doughnuts arrived before our coffee  (not the order we would have preferred).  They are round large doughnut holes with cinnamon sugar and three dipping sauces...chocolate, caramel and berry.  The caramel was both of our favorites.  We enjoyed it, but would have enjoyed it a lot more at half the $14 price.  Coffee was good and surprise-surprise not crazy expensive at $3.50 each.  Although we were not offered a  refill.  Two more things that we weren't crazy about...no restrooms in the place.  Yes, I know that's not unusual for Vegas, but for a restaurant of this caliber?  And the other thing that got annoying was the repetitive spiel that the Servers all use.  Tables are close enough together so we couldn't help but hear them recommending how many dishes to order, etc. etc.  Good to be trained on the selling aspect, but more attention to detail like silverware, and caring if you've gotten a lap full of water might be important also.  Yes I realize this is Vegas and the Strip and the Cosmopolitan, and we expected high prices, have happily paid them in the past for celebrity chef experiences, but this time the experience, especially considering the service, didn't warrant them.   Which is why the 5-star review I was sure I was going to write, is a 3-star.  A-ok.

UAYfsLxlAqh7IIiwFFU62w.text: I've been to both the New York and Las Vegas locations and both provide a great atmosphere, service and food! You first enter by walking into a pawn shop, which then has a door at the back of the store which leads to the actual restaurant. Such a cool concept! The restaurant vibe is very fun and chic, with dim lights and music and the restaurant is always busy!   For the most part, all the plates are sharing dishes which makes it great for a group! I went to the Vegas location for bachelorette party, and while some dishes only came with 4 or 5 pieces, being a party of 6 they were able just to add another piece!     Food recommendations:  - Caesar Toast (creamy garlic, crispy chicken skin) - Grilled Cheese, Smoked Bacon & Tomato Soup Dumplings ~THESE ARE A MUST!!~ we got 2 orders of them because they are just so delicious!! - Asian Chicken & Dumplings  - K - Town Bao Burgers - Tuna Poke Wonton Tacos

3L-1m42xoizJw0bpGWtrjA.text: This was an amazing meal.  The restaurant alone is gorgeous, breathtaking, and cool. The food was so delicious. zjyauM5-JPsR6P8mlZebAg.text: Yes!!!!! Try the ahi and you will love it. Super cool vibe. Not cheap but worth the trip. Make reservations for sure.

RMXpbhbCY2lY4P7xuIeGxg.text: Amazing food and service. We had to Tomahawk and bone marrow. The bone marrow is to die for. Tge steak is very juicy be all seasoned and charred. Cant go wrong with the salad with pecans. Overall I would like to give them 6 stars if I can!!!!! I will be back tonight. I am already craving

1xQG3knZKsO5SpSy7hWgCw.text: 5 stars for the customer service - it's already stressful enough to plan a bachelorette party, so when you miss your reservation time by 30 minutes on a Friday night, I'm pretty lucky we only had to wait 25 minutes to even get seated at all.  Our waitress was fantastic - being a group of 9 girls, she was prepared to give us our best options to try everything - our drinks were very good as well.  This was my second time here and both experiences have been great.  Only downside? It's really, really loud.

K4NdpmZVlSpAS5xXPS7GYQ.text: I like the store concept of the hidden entrance behind a shop. But knowing that this is Vegas. It's still a very fabricated feel. I found this to be in the pricier side and the dishes did not stand out to me in terms of originality. Drinks were also very expensive.
