8bjzAmRDta9VErFg97iYxA.text: Everything was delicious... I would recommend the yellowtail sashimi, Mexican street corn ravioli, grilled cheese and tomato soup dumplings, scallops and chicken ricotta meatballs. Great service too!

0F4grapJB7F7Yf5DmggZJQ.text: I love the concept of the speakeasy behind the pawn shop. The simple act of walking thru the nondescript door at the back of the pawn shop changes your outlook. It made me smile. The dining area is very lively. And very loud. But conversation is possible. The lighting, and interior decoration helps set the mood. The food and drinks were all shared across the table and the cocktails were very creative and well made. The Grilled Cheese Smoked Bacon & Tomato Soup Dumplings were a hit, as were the Poke tacos. The staff is super attentive, and they all take care of all customers. I highly recommend this spot.

9iE0wPdtEaq02DyPyS0pfA.text: I had my birthday dinner here with 3 friends and we had such a pleasant time! Service was outstanding, all our food was absolutely delicious (I personally tried the chicken lettuce cups and garganelli). I had a bite of friends' filet and kale salad and loved both of those. The finishing touch was the beautiful dessert they brought out on the house for my birthday. Totally recommend this place! The only negative comment was the noise level (loud).

VvWQBqvXk-swNm-bDsx2nw.text: I love the ambience of this place! Dark, artsy and classy. The waitress was very attentive. Imagine an entrance like a Victorian, old antique jewelry store and the decor following that through out. Growing up with an aunt and uncle having the largest antique store in Cape Cod, I immediately fell in love with the style.   If you have ever been to Jaleo (another excellent spot) in the Cosmopolitan (3rd floor) this is directly across from there.   2 of my girlfriends and I tried the kale apple salad, the tomato soup grilled cheese dumplings amuse bouche and a pesto dish.   I had the Oaxaca old fashion and it was divine,  mezcal and I revisited an old affair we once had.   The booth we sat in was round and sort of private but it seemed that this place is set up to accommodate larger groups as well as there was a party of over 10 sitting in the center.   Highly recommend for a classy evening out.

ykGnT5OxEFE4PAcpfHXfUw.text: Love this place! I wanted to come here a few months back with a friend but they were closed at the time. I tried it a couple weeks ago and it was amazing. Small portions but delicious and perfect if you still want to be able to drink afterwards! We ordered steak that came with three different sauces, a tomato soup with grilled cheese (not what you think, try it) and some ahi tuna tacos, all with a bottle of wine. Loved our waiter and the service. Must try!!!

G3f0giMa6YTM_ENFiO8-hg.text: To start, 3 stars because the food is average! For a chef seen on Chopped that holds high standards for the food, I was sadly let down and he would have been chopped, especially for the prices charged, which I have no problem paying for if great high quality food!  I read a few reviews on Yelp before going in. We started with the Yellowtail sashimi: delicious! We then moved to the Greek toast: good, yet not the best I have had. We then moved to the bone marrow with marmalade: bone marrow very salty yet overall a very mediocre and not a memorable dish... very disappointing. We ordered the grilled cheese with bacon dumplings and tomato soup: it did not taste anything like grilled cheese and the tomato soup tasted more like chef boy-r-d ravioli sauce. Just no!!!  Underwhelming. We tried the onion rings and do not get the hype... not better than anywhere else yet overpriced. Our waitress recommended the Brussels sprouts: why???? They were horrible, and I like Brussel sprouts! We barely touched any of it as it was awful. Our last two dishes were the Thai chicken main course: delicious!!! The other was the scallops: again, why the hype? They were more bland and boring than yummy.  We did not bother getting dessert because we did not want to face more disappointment.  You enter the restaurant by going through a pawn shop. The restaurant is very pretty and the service is friendly, but a major tip is the following: each waiter told their table what their favorite things are and that we should order it... don't listen!!! Our waitress had horrible recommendations!  The food is mostly average, some really bad and some really good. Overall, just blah. I would not recommend it at current prices... way too many places that are way better in Vegas for that price.

oc-nsLIfGi9ziaig8dpdfw.text: Man this was disappointing!! I loved loved loved the vibe... super swanky, boujie atmosphere, with club music. It was like being at a Hollywood party that serves appetizers; one of those celebrity type vibes that only "The Who's Who" get invited. I found it ultra sexy. Our waiter, Ian, was adorable and informed. Thought we had found a new spot to add to our Vegas restaurants, but food wise it just wasn't amazing. The atmosphere sets you up for great food as you watch little plates and spoons circulate the room. I mean, presentation is everything right? But the food misses a note across your pallet. It's not that it's bad... But it lacks heat, acid, and most importantly, salt.  Quite simply, the food just doesn't pop in your mouth with tons of flavor.  We really wanted to like it and kept ordering stuff, but it was just a fizzle... What it boils down to is the food does not equate with the bill or the atmosphere. So come for drinks, a few little bites, dress cute... but know you are just there for the scene.

SwbVa22t4sTDJiQy5eoDeA.text: Went to this place for brunch.  The food was so good.  The ambiance was nice and the waiters were friendly.  I would like to go to this place for dinner.

RPbwycRTPSlv0AYAiRVptQ.text: I love this restaurant and have been before with great service. This evening I had to wait over 30 minutes for an 8:30pm reservation for which we arrived on time. This is unacceptable. I'm celebrating my birthday and made my reservation over a month ago- the hosts made no effort to do anything or even apologize. When finally seated, we noticed multiple empty tables in the dining room which could have seated us.

uLeC6OGE7KENhAs-7M6c0w.text: The chicken meatballs were our favorite!! Nice restaurant, loved the atmosphere. Quick service. Will definitely return!

6QTPJ4LlyRfLdf7OSH89Xw.text: My boyfriend and I thought this place was fantastic. Such a cool setup.  We had the following menu items: -Tomato soup dumplings -Caesar toast -Mini burgers and fries  Everything was so tasty. It's all made to share, which is my favorite way to eat. Can't wait to come back!

r9AyYoVrg4OMF5r_3FgyBQ.text: If you're in Vegas you MUST come here!!!! Its located at the top of the cosmopolitan hotel, and from the outside it looks like a retail store.   I LOVED IT!!! Everything was great!!!  The service was absolutely perfect, Marisa our waitress, made sure our experience was beyond on point.   The decor is so fun and cool!! The chandeliers are breathtaking. Well done!   The food... WOW! I could write about each dish for days. I haven't had an experience like this in awhile. The dishes are tapas style which I love because you're able to try so many more dishes.   If I had to pick my top favorites:  steak tartare east and west oysters  braised chicken meatballs basil ravioli  butterscotch pot de cream

ab4CuGwVRWsyC0vOaGb9wQ.text: This place is sexy and Uber cool. Functional pawn shop up front low key dim lit speakeasy restaurant in back with a tasty steak and so many nice little tapas. Cool place 2 take a date and it's in the Cosmo what more could you ask for!!

eUGGKOs0Pp5KvgoMKBXnwA.text: It was fun to visit this restaurant. It was loud and had interesting decor. Able to take a photo booth pic as we left the restaurant. Service was good, but rushed. They gave good suggestions on what to order. Highly recommend the yellow tail sashimi that was flavor town. We also ordered the short rib Mac and cheese and grilled cheese tomato dumplings. We got the dumplings because it was the most popular on the menu.  The short rib Mac was missing some beef barely got any. They were tasty, I wouldn't go back just for those dishes. It was quite pricy for these small tapas. We were in at 9:00 and left in 1hr. The service was very attentive in the beginning then it died down after we only ordered 3 dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short rib Mac and cheese, grilled cheese and tomato dumplings, yellow tail sashimi
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front of restaurant!

Z6RIGk9292YlKadYuyMVRw.text: Good food, amazing ambience but unbelievably loud. You will literally have to shout to be heard by people next to you. I know loud is the new normal for trendy foodie places but the noise here is way in excess of anything I've come across.

IJBLHwrOLIDn7X6SyadOqA.text: Cozy and posh family style  You probably know this already, but to find Beauty and Essex you need to wade through a pawn shop full of pastiche such as a mini Biggie Smalls and faux jewelry. There is nothing fake about the food when you finally get to your table.   Dishes are served family rustic style which was perfect for our group. The tomahawk steak was done to perfection as were the prawns and tuna poke. Dishes are not huge but it is well priced for the quality you get and their wine list is well considered.

yNlc3S5prEWnsbXd5PJz9g.text: Restaurant is hidden behind what appears to be a quiet pawn shop - very cool. Once inside, the atmosphere instantly changed to a hip vibe of nightlife and energy. I love the ambiance of this place! Dark, artsy and classy.   We had reservations and were seated right away. Service was slow at times.... took awhile to order our drinks. Once our server came over, he provided good suggestions and mentioned that we should order 7-8 pieces per person (we had 4 in our group). When it came time to order, we had order 6 dishes and again mentioned that we should order 7-8 per person and that we should to order more. He was pushy and I didn't like that! We appreciate the suggestions but let us order what we want, we can always order more (and we did of our favorite dish).   Our order consisted of.... - Tomato Tartare - sooo good! We ended up ordering a second order.  - Grilled Cheese & Tomato Soup Dumplings - wayyyy overrated  - Tuna Poke Wonton Tacos - standard tuna poke tacos.. good but not the standout dish.  - Thai Style Fried Shrimp - loved the shrimp!  - Elote Style Scallops - served with corn salad, very tasty!  - Garganelli - very good pasta dish!  - Sliders   Overall, the food was fantastic, service was mehhh!

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IJkwQWoaHApuMJEbeJ3Qng.text: Blown away.  Good was oh so good.  I have to say that the ambiance is killer and the service was fab.  I did feel a little mislead in the amount of food we got because there was WAY too much,  but at least it was really good.  It's tapas style,  so sharing is caring.  And the other reviews were right on,  the grilled cheese spoons were to die for.  I also highly recommend the steak toast.  For some reason I thought the bone marrow was just a tick to salty for my taste,  but the rest of it was seasoned perfectly.  A True dining experience,  and I will definitely be back for date night!

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. avocado toast
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fois toast.  Drool!
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone marrow.

pBoYXyriWQM_nPp4wT51Ow.text: I'm so glad I discovered Beauty & Essex in the Cosmopolitan!  It's totally hidden away in what looks like a jewelry pawn shop, but behind the secret door is a fabulous restaurant with gorgeous decor, great service, and yummy food!  The menu features small plates and it's definitely worth sharing to try more of the amazing menu!  I would especially recommend:  Tuna Poke wonton tacos Arancini Kale & Apple Salad Avocado toast Broccolini Yellowtail sashimi  The decor is just fabulous, adding to the overall experience and vibe.  Don't miss Beauty & Essex!

ZKQlwWZpxDjiXxB8Uryo2g.text: One of my fav places to eat! Highly recommend coming here. Make reservations. Service was excellent, friendly and fast. Served tapas style fun to go with a group. We had Salmon Ceviche, Tuna Poke Wonton Tacos, Tomato and Creamy Burrata, Chile Relleno empanadas, grilled cheese tomato soup dumplings, and as a treat they served me chocolate fudge cake pops for celebration of my bachelorette party.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

22eTTN5P_K9LVie0yglguQ.text: Gaaahhh this place is beautiful! The food was exceptional and the service was top notch! Everything we ordered was delicious and we ordered just about everything on the menu. The standout dishes to me were the Tuna Poke Wonton Tacos, Grilled Cheese Tomato Soup Dumplings, Roasted Bone Marrow, Pan Seared Scallops, Lobster Mac n Cheese, Classic Filet and the Devil's Food Layer Cake. We went to dinner before a show, the server asked what time our show was at and made sure that everything came out and we checked out in time to get to our show, super professional and thoughtful. The hostess offered to take photos of my cousin and I and we're telling us where the good lighting was and took a ton of photos. They were all super nice! All of the staff went above and beyond to make our experience amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A_DBjxMDoymHm7DmZIXTUw.text: We very much loved our experience at B&E.   We liked the vibe of this place - walking through the pawn shop to get to the restaurant. It is a swanky, dark place. Very cool and a good crowd.   Between the two of us, we ordered just three things: the bone marrow, the foie gras, and the scallops. We couldn't believe how delicious everything was. We were planning on ordering more but we were actually very satisfied after those three items.  We ordered two cocktails, which were tasty and VERY strong. While everything is expensive, it is worth it to splurge at this place. The service was fantastic, the food was great, the cocktails were nice, and the atmosphere was high class. We would definitely return to this location.

Jvx74KppoF-SL8athzBLfg.text: While the place has a unique vibe, it really seemed to just be a trendy place to go.  I honestly wouldn't be surprised if it empties out in the next year.  It's very dark, crowded, and loud.  We had a reservation and had to wait quite a while to get our table.  We were crammed in so close together that we could barely lift our arms to eat.  There were so many tables crammed into one room that it was hard to hold a conversation.  The food was tasty, but the portions were pretty small compared to their price tag.  Tapas served with an entree price tag.

69FPsL-Bs_OBeWR-9ozn-w.text: Been wanting to try the LA location for a while but hadn't made it out yet.  When my friend booked the Cosmopolitan for her birthday in Vegas, and I saw that there was one in the hotel then it was a great opportunity.  I made reservations for Fri night.  I did not have high expectations for this place.  From my previous experiences with restaurants like this one, their food and service is usually subpar. We hadn't eaten all day and when we arrived we were all starving.    Can we also talk about the decor.. So beautiful and tastefully done.  The framed necklaces that hang from the walls.  Such a great idea.     For the 4 of us we must have ordered about 10 or more items from the menu to share.  I mean... come on!!  Everything was so delicious!!! We were very impressed.  We could not stop talking about the food.    Must try: Brussels sprout salad                Beef sliders                Bone marrow                Anything on toast. lol                Steak....like yum!!                 Chorizo Mac n' Cheese (minus the peas for me)  Can wait to try the LA location. Hopefully our experience will be the same.  Sometimes it makes a difference due to the chef.

tHhLZVJ4yA6LivpRdDME2A.text: I've heard so many good things about B&E & I'm glad I got to finally try this place out! I would definitely recommend making reservations. It's dimly lit and really loud especially bc they bump hip hop music & maybe because there were a lot of groups last night.  We started off with Caesar Toasts, Roasted Bone Marrow & my fiance ordered a Half Dozen Oysters. The only thing he mentioned was that he wished he'd order all West Coast oysters (I personally don't like oysters so I had no preference). Caesar Toast was good but I wouldn't order it again. It literally tastes like Caesar salad on a a piece of toast. The Roasted Bone Marrow is really good & the server will gladly explain how to eat it if you've never had it before.  The Garganelli was the biggest portion & the most filling. It had bolognese sauce & gorgonzola cheese. One of the most popular dishes, Elote Style Scallops, seems quite simple but is something I'll be craving from now on. It was that good!  This makes a great place for date night & I would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Doughnuts (tastes just like malasadas)
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garganelli &amp; Eloté Style Scallops
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Bone Marrow, soooo good!

tk3qY-Fi_CKh_dxt5tfrLQ.text: Had the Woodsman cocktail here, tasty, although the All Spice Dram dominated the cocktail. I was very impressed with this place. The aesthetics are outstanding. You enter the restaurant through the door in the corner of a pawn shop and then it's glamour and classy wood furniture. The bar uses fresh nectar and fruits. Very delicious. Have to come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_9262OvufiMYg5bRaS7jXQ.text: This place was definitely "happening" on a Friday night. We arrived "fashionably" late and had to wait "fashionably" by the bar for our table.   Hip spot with people soaking in the fabulosity. Ambiance was nice with dimmed lighting and cool decor.  We ordered the short rib mac & cheese and the rib eye. Both were pretty decent but don't think I would order either dish again. The $60 steak they served us was kinda cold & the mac & cheese was not creamy. This restaurant is definitely a good time. Food is not bad. They focus more on presentation and being unique. Go somewhere else if you're looking for GOOD food.

pIDe2iC6DnqTZOMbgIpTMg.text: One of my all time favourite restaurants. I've been to the original location in New York which took me months to reserve in advance. I was happy to hear that Beauty & Essex opened a second location in Vegas!   The cocktail menu is impeccable. There's always such a good selection and my personal favourite is either the Bubbly or Beauty Elixir. Both are must tries when you go.   As a tapas place, the portions are quite sizable and great for sharing in groups of 3! However, you can always ask them to prepare a 4th portion on the plate if you're a group of 4. We were a group of 3 so it was perfect and shared 5 dishes (they recommended 6-8 plates).   To start we had the Apple Kale Salad -- my personal fav! There was enough for us to get 2 portions each or 1 full plate each. Then we got the Brussels sprouts (delectable) side with the ravioli, the spaghettini and the mushroom pizza (3 pieces each). All of them were so good and I would highly recommend each of them. Also, the mac and cheese and TO DIE FOR. We didn't get it this time around but I've had it in the past and I would say it's a must-get.   Overall the vibe is super trendy and young. I love the entrance in is through a pawn shop. It's great for parties and bachelorette celebrations. Also the service is on point. :)

ESq5ir5s21hr-AAYv-TBEw.text: Did you guys know that there is this secret restaurant in Vegas that is disguised as a pawn shop. Well beauty and Essex is it, I went here with friends and when I walked in here at first I was like WTF is this, then we got escorted through a secret door and there was this huge restaurant. We had the oysters which was $35 and I didn't think it was worth paying that much for it. For wntree I ordered the lamb chops (medium rare) and boy Oh boy am I glad I ordered that, it was simply amazing I was in such a blissful place while devouring the lamb chops that sat on top of the bed of Yukon gold mashed potatoes. The whole plate was simply beautiful.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Succulent, juicy, tasty, flavorful lamb chops..

mRDTLEc3k3mnkNsv-Er3EA.text: Delicious food! Mostly small plates so you get to share and try lots of different things. Everything was delicious! The tuna poke tacos were amazing! Definitely a bit pricey but everything was really good. I would highly recommend this place if you were in Vegas and looking for great food!

isxjBynYziYS_KjYMg-r4w.text: I love dinning at beauty & Essex. I came in with a very large party and the waiter was so accommodating to everyone needs. Since the food is mostly small plates I was able to taste so much of the menu. My favorites include the chicken meatballs, grilled cheese, zucchini pasta, tuna poke tacos and the kale apple salads.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cmWTuaF2k5dk7KUDaKQuGA.text: My wife insisted we check out Beauty & Essex one Sunday night while in Las Vegas. Overall, a fun experience and a lively spot that is great for groups and dates alike. We were ushered in through a non descript door and taken into the main area where once seated, we were in a loud and lively dining area. The rooms are split up a bit and there is a bar up front as well.   We ordered drinks and then proceeded to try a number of menu items: ceviche, roasted bone marrow, foie gras, dry aged chick sliders, short rib mac n cheese, and elote style scallops. Everything was good (especially the bone marrow and mac n cheese) though I felt the sliders were less juicy than I expected.   After dinner, we headed to Milk and got ice cream to top off a delicious meal! I recommend coming hungry because portions are well sized and I left stuffed.

mt3gJjtLaTEHmNfZICpJlQ.text: Tried out Beauty & Essex opening night! Starts with a gander through a pawn shop. While there are some elegant items, this novelty should wear off relatively quickly. Who wants to buy something in a pawn shop prior to going to dinner? INtriguing?  Enticing?  Elegant interior design throughout! Nice bar too but very small.   It was opening so they were very overstaffed. It feels a bit bizarre because there is no room in the kitchen for the staff to stand around. They just camp out by your tables.  Service was impeccable for that reason!  Appetizers were spot on delicious but our pork chops very chewy, fatty, and we had to send them back.  The manager was fabulous though, very apologetic and brought out a tenderloin that was to die for, sliced thin and cooked to perfection.  We will go back.

Zm5am60iiCziDmABN-Z1xQ.text: This is a really good restaurant at Cosmopolitan Hotel Las Vegas. Food is so good and delicious. Also all about service is nice and they're always take care your table so many times. And special for me is about the cocktail so good. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nRxKqt3ThGQ7ODe2SSm5hw.text: My wife and I current favorite in Las Vegas! It's an amazing dining experience, the Tomato soup wontons, chicken Tandori, and tons of other dishes are next level. It's a elite dining experience in a poppin hotel. The Cosmo is one of the best spots in Vegas

Kfaqnkc3ZlFPbfGdyAnF4A.text: Such a fun experience going to this restaurant.  The food is amazing and the atmosphere cannot be beat. The pawnshop experience only adds to the character of this place.   Have been to the one in New York and the one in Las Vegas and each one was amazing. Staff extremely friendly and everything we tried on the menu was stunning we

f3hs4sqUh7MTJmyD6zT7Eg.text: Went in a couple of months ago and had a tasting menu there with some friends. It was all good. The Smoked cheese dumplings and tomato soup spoons were incredible.  The scallops were equally fantastic. So much flavor going on with the scallops.  We finned off with the butterscotch Panacotta and the Frozen strawberry cheese cake rolled in CAPTAIN FREAKIN CRUNCH!!  Bravo.   Great place and vibe. It is very trendy so it can get a bit busy and loud, but they make up for it with great food and drinks as well as service.   Everything is so good there I'm sending 12 VIPS there on Tuesday. Raul the manager is always on point an so easy to work with.

4KRUxqKtf25NKaY0VL8MkQ.text: I'm so conflicted for my review of this place. Went on a Saturday night at 715, Place was bumping- great energy, full house, very loud (Canada said would have been better is music was louder to drown out the loud voices). I thought the ambiance was great, really enjoyed it. Service was great too. And the food was good...it just seemed a bit disjointed to me, like they have an identity crisis and don't quite know what to specialize in. The menu doesn't seem to fit the space. We ordered octopus tacos: small portion, tortilla was a bit thick for the insides- think this would be better just plated- skip the taco part, overall was mediocre. Empanadas- I enjoyed these, flavors reminded me of a green chili tamale- I skipped the edges of the crust though, was just overkill, but Good bite size portion. Chicken & dumplings- cool presentation, but the sauce left something to be desired- we each skipped the sauce after the first one & just ate the dumpling- which was a bit thick but good. Mexican street corn ravioli- this was a surprise & delight- really enjoyed it and seemed inventive. And the Mediterranean cauliflower. This seemed to miss the mark. No where on the menu does it say 'curry', but it was curried cauliflower- I guess the yogurt was Mediterranean? Who knows. The whole meal was decent, but didn't seem to flow, seemed disjointed in flavor combinations. Atmosphere was good though. Honestly, not sure I'd recommend.

txIlS2lwAqRbnBHQwM3lhQ.text: This place was nice. Positive stars for ambiance, decor and friendly staff. The decor was so unique. Our waiter was very friendly. However the food was just ok to me. The only thing I enjoyed was the lobster rolls- only because of the bread.  The drinks were average as well. I would suggest coming here if you're already full and just want the ambiance experience. The cool speakeasy front store and Decor was worth the mediocre food.

wL9tnXUaFUr4GbfQB0fqjQ.text: Straight up 5 stars for the service and the atmosphere. What a beautiful space: sexy, dark, mysterious, cozy, romantic, & comfortable coupled with the most top notch service I've ever experienced (even compared to Michelin star spots in SF).   My boyfriend and I came in for his birthday on a Wednesday night, he was wished happy birthday right away by the hostess and as we walked to our table, every waiter, busboy, back-server said hello and welcome- even as the restaurant was packed!  Our server, Rozettie, was PHENOMENAL! She was friendly, smiley, knowledgable about everything, attentive and helpful! Our water glasses were never more than half empty, we were never without a cocktail and she coursed the food perfectly. Seriously, I would come back here again for the service alone.  We got to interact with one of the mangers as well and he was fantastic too! Warm, gracious, hilarious, friendly. (I wish I remembered his name!!)  The ambiance and the service give this place 5 stars- as the food itself is really 4 star worthy. Everything is very simple and a little underseasoned. For us, who go out to eat at great places often, we weren't that impressed, especially for the price. But that being said, it was still really good. The bone marrow & the soup dumpling were highlights for sure. I'd say to avoid the pork belly entree- a confused and incohesive dish.  For 2 people: 4 cocktails, 5 dishes came to about $240  TL;DR: GREAT service / GREAT atmosphere / good food

_LAJqlGJu6CIELOeou0Apg.text: Frequent flyers of Vegas and usually always end up at Mastro's. Decided to try something new and ended up here. Walked in on a Saturday night with no reservations so was expecting to wait (party of 2). Went to the bar had some great drinks. We were sat at a table in about 25 minuets which I thought was great.   Our server was "Dave"... he definitely made the night. He was awesome. He was easy going, help with suggestions as we asked and very funny. The food was fantastic and so was the vibe inside   Will be back for sure

RTCY26OsYA7esItmcvnQdA.text: Very good price and food. I had a bit of everything and we all shared in our table. One of my favorites was the mac and cheese.   Portions are not as small as you would think so don't over do it. My portions were very big to be honest, we couldn't eat everything we ordered and we didn't have dessert.   I recommend it 100%, it was my favorite while in Vegas.

9M0SuHV4sMoU5Vz-CIWzHA.text: Love the food and the atmosphere... the reasons for the 4 instead of 5 are: how loud it was, had to yell because they crammed so many people into the dining space. Good service and love tapas for trying new dishes.

so3mwIn8ytPZTf-6zD7SAQ.text: I'm in love with this place and was happy to learn there was an East Coast location.  Came here to celebrate a birthday and was already entranced with the pawn store front.  We lingered for a good ten minutes before being escorted through the door and into the main restaurant, which was gorgeous in design.  I was a bit thrown off by the ambiance as the decor was very clean, old-fashioned, dark, and beautifully constructed in contrast to the DJ spinning the best in classic and current R&B/Hip-Hop tracks. Food was amazing and in tapas style so the more you order the fuller you are, and came out very quickly.  Drinks were strong--like put-you-on-your-back-strong--so the prices made sense. Definitely suitable for large groups. Great concept and great food.

Q5jQkID-4nlyZn4Gc-7JGg.text: So this place has so much to offer. I like to come to the bar and drink. The bar peeps are the best. The first drink I ordered I didn't like. So even though I was just gonna suffer through the amazing mixologist said "no". You don't like it. Let me make you something better. Bam she did it.  Please make sure Alison takes your drink order at the bar. You will be swerved well.

yzNXWVDpUNo10xnQ0hsP9Q.text: As an ex-New Yorker who had frequented Beauty & Essex in the Lower East Side, I was excited that this was chosen for a work dinner.  The raw dishes were very fresh (we ordered salmon ceviche, tuna poke tacos) and the other app we got (tomato soup & grilled cheese) was a big hit.  The mains (we ordered the lamb chops, the sirloin, and the pulled pork) were also great. Of course, expect it to be on the pricier side, but it is Las Vegas, and it is the Cosmopolitan hotel.  The drinks were decent - classic martini, bubbles & berries, a mezcal drink, and red wine, but not out of this world.  We had asked our server to please parcel out the dishes if he could, and they ended up coming out all at once. He also asked us about dietary restrictions four times, where it become the running joke of our table. It's nice that he double checked, but asking 4 times made us feel like he was mixing up his tables. We get that they were busy, but we had to ask for silverware/sharing plates, with our food sitting there for awhile.  Love the food and the atmosphere but the staff could use some more support.

4PQCm3fqBeQAvCk1uQDr3g.text: Beauty & Essex is one Vegas restaurant that's doing absolutely everything right.  It's the full package -- gorgeous ambiance, gracious service, and outstanding food.  Located in the third-floor restaurant zone of the Cosmo, I was impressed by B&E before I even reached the host stand.  As you enter, you pass through a beautiful "pawn shop" selling jewelry, guitars, and (perhaps most importantly) copies of Chris Santos' cookbook.  The vibe changes entirely once you enter the restaurant proper, which is covered in stands of pearls and sumptuous decor.  My guest and I opted for seats at the lively bar.  Before long, the bartendress took our dinner orders, and I had a delicious glass of Malbec in hand.  B&E specializes in small plates, which are meant for sharing.  Three plates were just the right amount of food for a dinner for two:  1) Short rib mac and cheese.  Probably the best mac and cheese plates I've ever had.  The cheese was gooey and delicious -- but not heavy.  The short rib was tender and shone through nicely.  The jalapeno cornbread crust provided the perfect crunch.  2) Ratatouille with zucchini, yellow squash, tomato, and piperade.  The perfect accompaniment to the mac and cheese.  The dish was stunning to look at, and the flavor was excellent too, with a nice spicy kick from the piperade.  3) Kygo "cloud nine" s'mores with dark chocolate torte, pecan graham crumble, marshmallow clouds, and chocolate sauce.  One of the most fabulous, indulgent desserts I've ever seen.  It's a veritable mountain of delicious chocolate, swimming in marshmallow goodness.  The behemoth portion size was an added bonus.  Throughout our dinner, service was friendly and prompt.  Also friendly were the other patrons at the bar.  Everyone at B&E seems to be there for good food, good times, and minimum pretensions.  That's like my kind of place.  Bravo, Chris Santos -- B&E is exactly what the Vegas dining scene needed.  I can't wait to pay your restaurant another visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kygo cloud nine s&#39;mores
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ratatouille
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. short rib mac and cheese

Gt-TU9K1bihRh9BdthIioA.text: Loved loved loved!  We tried six veggie items and each and every one of the dishes was excellent. The grilled cheese bites in tomatoe soup was heaven. Wish it wasn't tapas at this point. Probably the best grilled cheese I've ever had. Everything from the kale apple salad, empanadas, Ravioli, to onion rings was delicious.  Chris Santos please open Beauty and Essex in the Bay Area!!!!!

TvczsAPyQh_iRewVLK6Szg.text: My husband and I found this gem while we were exploring The Cosmopolitan. We had heard about the one in New York, so we knew we wanted to try it. We stopped into the pawn shop, you have to walk through there to get into the restaurant. The woman told us they opened at 5:30. At around 6 I called for a reservation. They said that there wasn't an available table until 9:15. So we just decided to take a chance and walk in on our own time.   We got there at 8:30 and immediately sat down at a table. The wait staff is very friendly and our waitress helped us pick a drink right away. The drinks were great! The food was even better. We shared 3 things. The grilled cheese bites, the onion rings, and the burger with fries. Everything was so tasty. Service and staff were great.   The only reason I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because when I called for a reservation they said they didn't have any open tables until 9:15 and we were able to walk right in at 8:30. And there were many open tables.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious

NoOcezHMkIzFq-sfpduTgg.text: This restaurant is located inside the Cosmopolitan. It definitely has a speakeasy theme as it's hidden behind a pawn shop. True to the theme, it's dark and dimly lit inside. The decor is retro, chic and sleek.   Looking at the pawn shop, you would think this place is small, but it's actually pretty large.   The food was good.   The portions were small (tapas style).   It's Vegas so it's not surprising that this place is pretty pricey. $15+ per order and you need at least 3 orders per person if you're there for a meal and not just drinks and a snack.   This is what we had:  ---Thai Style Deep-Fried Shrimp $21 (My favorite)  ---Roasted Bone Marrow $19 (Very small amount)  ---Grilled Cheese & Tomato Soup Dumplings $18 (They were unique and delicious)  ---Paprika Spiced Salmon $29 ---Maine Lobster Roll $19  --- Side of Cauliflower $12  Perhaps the fake storefront is too good at concealing this restaurant as it was nearly empty while we were there.    Definitely worth trying at least once.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai Style Deep-Fried Shrimp $21 and Paprika Spiced Salmon with Cauliflower $29
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Cheese, BACON, &amp; Tomato Soup Dumplings $18
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bone Marrow $19

aTBFc2y5Aix_eB6tXvQPTw.text: The best part of Beauty & Essex is the atmosphere. When you come in it has the front of a pawn shop, but then you go back into the restaurant, which feels similar to a speak-easy. Fantastic, down to small details.   The food was excellent. My favorite dish, and one of their most popular, was the grilled cheese and tomato soup dumplings. Taste like comfort food but in an original presentation.   My other favorite dish was the kale and apple salad. All predictable ingredients, but the dressing was perfect.   All the other dishes we ate were great.   My only complaint is that all of our food came out really quickly, leading to a very full table and dishes getting lukewarm. I like it when a restaurant is purposeful in the ordering and timing of dishes, and that was lacking here.   Overall though I recommend trying it out! You won't be disappointed!

SZxgjhNo0UfQGZvML5ZL_w.text: I had the best meal of my life at Beauty & Essex.  The environment is so fun, going through the jewelry pawn shop inside the Cosmo makes it feel like an event.  The menu is set up small plate style which is a perfect opportunity to try lots of different things.  We ordered the tuna tacos, empanadas, tomato tartare, tomato soup dumplings, & ricotta chicken meatballs.  The tomato soup dumplings were incredible - everything you think of with comfort food in one perfect bite.  The tomato tartare was like nothing I had ever had before - tangy and tart topped with a smooth quail egg.  The meatballs had flavor I didn't even realize could be created with truffle oil and ricotta.  This was an absolutely incredible meal.

r5LkDgOsS71AWh5e6NHv2g.text: We were a party of 8 and we had a 10:30 reservation last night. We were done by 11. I've never ordered food and had it all come out within 5-8 minutes. I felt like it was leftovers or things that were already pre-made waiting to be sent out. We didn't enjoy the restaurant, the dining experience. We felt so rush, we didn't even know what we were eating. We weren't done with some of our items and they kept coming to clear our table. I felt like I was at a fast food restaurant, not an upscale restaurant. We were out in 30 minutes, it shocked us all!

5yCfpL5PcDWj4XupIPPKWg.text: This restaurant is located in the beautiful and hip Cosmopolitan Hotel. Upon entry, you will pass through a pawn shop before you enter a beautiful restaurant with beautiful people. The service and food are amazing too :). Please try the chile relleno empanadas and the Mexican Street corn ravioli when you are there. Your mouth will thank you, but your waist circumference will hate you.

n1wz4g8wGwxPrBtApSvWiA.text: Came for drinks, while waiting for our dinner reservation at STK.  Space was nice and modern; younger to middle-aged patrons; service is slow, but drinks are good.  Drinks- cocktails (sweet): The ODB: 4 Bubbles and Berries: 4  Ambiance: 4

cXF5CIhKFOlq3ZjNIQnfDA.text: We came here on a Monday evening with reservations and were seated right away.   For a group of 4, we ordered:  Beets and creamy burrata: good  Artichoke grilled flatbread: good Chile rellenos empanadas: delish Grilled cheese and tomato soup dumplings (w/o bacon): not worth it  Croque monsieur mac and cheese (w/o ham): not worth it  Mexican street corn ravioli: amazing Tiramisu sundae: delish, but def need to share it with your whole group   Service was good! They have a vegan/vegetarian menu.   Parking: located inside of Cosmopolitan hotel

_37MnOSfsM1sf8h5RZp9ew.text: Sharing Is Caring  The mysterious B&E is enclosed behind a well lit Pawn Shop on the 3rd floor of The Cosmopolitan of Las Boulevard Tower. This floor has soo many amazing scents your liable to change your reservation (trust me I was tempted).  If your a BOUGIE diner like myself you'll appreciate all the vintage pearls and necklace decor. The music is loud as heck, the service was prompt, and the food most importantly was bomb af!  Tuna Poke Wonton Tacos $17 Octopus Tacos  Grilled Cheesed (w/o bacon) & Tomato Soup Dumplings $18 Thai Style Deep-Fried Shrimp $22 Broccolini $12 Mexican Street Corn Ravioli  $22  Bubbles & Berries $17 Taittinger Champagne, Belvedere Vodka, St. Germain Liqueur, muddled strawberries O.D.B. "Old Dirty Bramble" $17 Maestro Dobel 'Diamante' Tequila, smoked blackberries, honey, ginger, lemon    If your seeking a variety of light,satisfying shared plates without compromising your SPANX before painting the town pink; B&E is a glamorous Vegan friendly choice!

We had dinner out with old friends, and this elegant, well appointed, sophisticated culinary casa was an evening to remember. Sharing multiple small plates is an enjoyable experience yet the best part was simply enjoying the food. This was an evening to remember.

R765SUeH-dly2IeM4uIlKg.text: Super cool looking restaurant, super expensive drinks & food.  There's no need for these tiny portions at ridiculous prices. I only drank water, the drink I wanted(which wasn't fancy)was $17! I only tried the corn raviolis, 5 or 6 came on a plate, that's it, for $24 I think. They were good, but not worth the $. It was hard to find something vegetarian & not expensive on the menu. We went for my daughters bday dinner, but prob will not go back. Had to have a snack when we got home bc I was still hungry

EtXWv2fZIj0YCUaXCKPu0Q.text: Great place for dates, friend gathering, great atmosphere.  Great wine, great food and great people.

Rcs6G8DAnc0vHY82zhwPJw.text: Great ambience and very nice menu. Most of the dishes are done well. Standouts are the chicken meatballs, the Korean chicken, and the BBQ-seasoned fries. 4/5 because the dishes could be slightly refined for a bit more flavor. Great cocktails.

9qAghhdl65-lBohXdlvigg.text: B&E is really cool, from the way you enter the restaurant (back door of a pawn shop) to the great dark vibe inside. The food was good...a bit pricey for what you get but I guess you're paying for the atmosphere as well. It was worth going once but I'm not too confident that we'll be back.

xsgoSC-9_iF3cRqLe-FJpg.text: Great food, great service and good ambience! We had the grilled cheese dumplings, shrimp cocktail, shishito peppers, filet and sirloin - all amazing! "Some of the best shrimp cocktail I've ever had" - my husband. The dumplings are presented beautifully and are very unique and the steak serving sizes were huge!   The only suggestion I would have for the restaurant (I swear I'm not old!!) is that it's extremely dark in there - turning the lights up even the tiniest bit would have been better so you can enjoy the surroundings more.  Looking forward to going back!

F37RrD9_PMYcbMoGdO5ANQ.text: This was our first time dining.  We stopped here on a previous visit for drinks.  The menu looks great from a distance and obviously the hidden entrance through the pawn shop will amuse just about everyone (especially on the first visit).  For first time diners, it's small plates.  We personally really like this concept as you get to try a broader selection of dishes.  Prices are higher than you'd probably like but not out of line with similar concepts in Vegas (i.e. the Julian Serrano family of restaurants).  Upon arriving, we found the atmosphere to be far more odd than we recalled it.  No dress code what so ever - think gentlemen in jackets and ladies in nice cocktail dresses mixed with dudes in sandals they bought at Sam's Club for $9.99.  I know dress codes in Vegas are not what they use to be and the concept of dressy casual confuses everyone, but surely management can enforce some type of reasonable minimum.  I would also note that the dining room is very dark - so dark that we saw multiple tables using the flashlights on their phones to read the menu.  There are no windows.  The tables are very close together and the room gets pretty loud.  Our first impression of service was at the bar.  I was quickly turned off when the bartender poured my fiancee's glass of wine out of two different bottles and then precisely (to the drop) measured my $17 Woodford Old Fashioned.  Ms. Bartender, your accountant loves you.  Upon being seated for our reservation, service improved.  While I found our server a little bit casual for my expectations, she was extremely prompt, dishes came out quickly, and the whole service team was quick to clear out dirty dishes and keep water glasses full.  Our server recommended 4-6 dishes for the two of us which in my view will vary based on exactly what you order.  A couple of the dishes we ordered (the Korean Fried Chicken and Grilled Cheese, Smoked Bacon, and Tomato Soup Dumplings) were basically just single bites.  If you favor these, you probably want to be on the high side of the recommended servings.  I'd point out that having a starters menu at a small plates concept is confusing to me but I won't digress.    Some quick takes on the dishes we ordered (in the order they were served to us):  Grilled Cheese, Smoked Bacon, and Tomato Soup Dumplings - Presentation on the Chinese soup spoons was very cool but  unfortunately so was the temperature - the soup was cold and the dumpling was only lukewarm.  While I found the taste of the dumpling to be a nice contrast to the pungent soup, overall I found the flavors here to be very mild and lacking excitement.  Caesar Toast - While I would probably normally save my calories for something else when eating out, we were browsing Yelp photos and were intrigued by the presentation and volume of photos of this dish.  The concept was great (think bruschetta but with other stuff) and their toast was absolutely perfect (not too crunchy, thick enough to easily support the toppings).  I found the salad to have way too much dressing but overall though this dish was tasty.  Korean Fried Chicken - Think excessively-chewy, cold, boneless sweet and sour chicken bites from Panda Express.  Do not order this.  I'm noticing a trend here - are their dishes meant to be served cold?!  Chorizo "Carbonara" Mac & Cheese - Average mac and cheese with chorizo thrown in - it needed a spicier sausage to contract with the smoky flavor of the cheese.  House-Made Cavatelli - this was the best thing we had.  The sausage was spicy and the dish came out piping hot.  Overall, I just couldn't get into Beauty & Essex.  I'm confounded by the 4 star overall review on Yelp.  The flavors just weren't that great and the overall experience (cold food, weird atmosphere) couldn't compensate.  I doubt I'd return on a future visit to Las Vegas.

U10cCe-EfcEJJXnX4iyFTg.text: What a sexy restaurant! Sorry, no other way to describe the vibe other than sexy and sophisticated.  The restaurant is located inside The Cosmopolitann Hotel and serves up tapas in cool and original ways!  The restaurant itself plays great music while you are eating, so be prepared and it is done in beautiful browns.....very romantic.  We started with the Grilled Peach and Burrata, went on to chile relleno Empanadas, herb crusted chicken w/watermelon and heirloom tomato salad.  Everything was delicious and featured flavors I would never put together but ended up pure bliss in my mouth!  Fantastic service from seating to our server the night was perfect! I would recommend reservations because the place was packed! Will be on our list next trip out!

1LRmzO9WTgGfcsl64fJ4wg.text: Wow.  This Pawn ? Antique store is pretty cool. There's all sorts of interesting items for sale. Well, perhaps, interesting items to behold and wonder if your AMEX card has a sufficient available balance to draw from.  There's a signed pair of sneakers of Notorious B.I.G and a Batman Pez with all sorts of things in between.  But, wait there's more. Actually, let's backup.  Beauty & Essex is cleverly located in the Cosmopolitan. Take the escaltors up past the dizzy aray of strung lights and make a right turn into an area that has a weirdly re-purposed Foosball table.  Yeah, you want to check that out.  In the middle space before entering Beauty & Essex, there's an area that's best described as an adult play area. It is outfitted with champagne buckets, a round table and stools.  It's even gated off like one of those play areas at a mall.  Clearly, we were not special enough to be invited in the ' play area'  Oh well.  So, it is at this point after seeing the Foosball table, the adult play area that we notice the front facing Beauty & Essex.  Again, it's an Antique and Pawn Shop or is it?????????  We entered and started chatting with the attendant and all the while, a couple who looked liked they just arrived from Burning Man walked into Beauty & Essex and went straight the back door and we never saw them again.  I thought, " Okay." then with a puzzled look on my face, I turned to my two companions and said, " Who were they?", Josh replied, " Probably the owners",   Possible?  Maybe, Highly Unlikely, More like it.  Anyways, we're looking at old matchbooks from the Casinos of yesteryear when two Hipsters, a Vegan, and Warlock walk into Beauty & Essex with a purpose and go straight to the door and disappear.  Now, my interest is peaked and I had to go to the door.    I open the door, and I suddenly realized that it is bigger in the inside than the outside.  It's a freaking Tardis, Doctor Who reference, No actually, Beauty & Essex is actually a speakeasy.  How cool is that?!?!?!  I immediately went back to the Pawn shop and retrieved my brother and my friend and said, " Guys, Guys.  Come with me."   We walked into the waiting area and a troop of hostesses asked if we had reservations, we politely responded by saying no, and asked if we can sit at the bar.    The restaurant and bar were full with patrons. The music was thumping classics like Technotronics and Run DMC.  The ambiance was really cool. Perhaps too cool for me and most likely too cool for us three guys but hey, we're in Vegas, so why not.  Josh decides to order a drink. I apologize that I don't remember what it was called but he said it was really good. I had an Espresso Martini.  We were at the corner end of the bar and it was spectacular scenery.  Watching the barmaids and the bartenders make all sorts of foo foo drinks, Hearing servers interact with the Barfolk, and then the patrons spilling into the bar and the restaurant. This is definitely a people watching spot.  My brother was tempted to order appetizers but we had recently ate so we just finished our drinks and left.     In the end, it was an amazing adventure.  The old Pet Shop Boys song comes to mind,  'You've got the brawn a and I've got the brains, let's make lot's of money.'    Looking forward to going back and running into the two Hipsters, a Vegan, and a Warlock.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Expeesso Martini

uS5ZztRixRD5SM2pXt57VQ.text: Don't go unless you want to feel like you're clubbing while eating.  The music is so loud that you literally cant see or taste your food.  The cocktails were really the-the ODB bramble had a rotten BlackBerry and tasted like fungus.  The shishito peppers were not blistered but somewhat boiled in oil.  The caesar toast was just overdressed salad on bread.  The cavatelli was overcooked, and the BBQ fries were way too seasoned.  It seems that everything is much too bold, and they try to hide it by making the lights as dim as possible until you cannot see the food, and the music so loud you cannot talk to your dining party without telling.  I feel sorry for this spot because when they opened it was good, and I think it may be replaced in a few years at this rate.

V6Xe4D92QHqKVFtXyxPMcA.text: I have only had B&E once for their breakfast/lunch menu and it was my first time having their dinner menu.   I shared cheese, beacon and tomato soup dumplings, kale & apple salad, Mexican Street corn ravioli, and Thai style shrimp.  The dumplings were good, but they weren't hot.  It is as if they were under a lamp and then served.  I think if it was served hot I would like it a lot betters.  The kale & apple salad was my favorite.  The table next to me had it and it looked so good.  The salad was fresh and very tasty.  I love the crunch of the apples.  The Mexican ravioli was really good; like an elote, but the flavor is on the ravioli.  The Thai style shrimp was on top of a bed of papaya-like salad.  The shrimp were jumbo-sized and pretty tasty.    If you dine here you get complimentary entry to Marquee.  A plus in my book.   Overall, I really loved the food here.  The service is great and I would love to come back.

s54lH_pY6_UAD4n6qKA9Ug.text: We missed our reservation at another restaurant and Beauty & Essex was literally the only restaurant that could accommodate us on a Saturday night in Vegas.   The host at the entrance was somehow rude but our waiter was nice and helpful. We ordered the BBQ fries which were average, the asparagus toast that came with no asparagus, the pasta which was mediocre and the chicken meatballs that were actually pretty good.   Cocktails are not worth it, at all. I couldn't even finished mine and my friend's was really awful.   Three stars for the decoration and ambience.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sRtH_9oWZn592tDFkB-ZTQ.text: This place is one of a kind. My wife and I went there for a nice dinner out in Vegas. It was so cool. Tons of stuff to look at inside and  the best part is the 'speak easy like' entrance thru the Pawn Shop. The food was amazing. Kinda like Tapas style with smaller portions. The fries and steaks are delcious. You gotta try the place at least once. I'm glad I did. Excellent service. Get reservations too.

QeiRW614ud9ZBTjI6725Dw.text: Well composed meal and presentation.  Great service.  Also love the store front with "speak easy" type entry into restaurant.  One of my favorites in Vegas.

3KvhwLlhp0dhyRt8Fprm_Q.text: Wifey took me here to celebrate my birthday and it was the best boomerang dinner! Parking was a breeze if you enter off Las Vegas Blvd, take the elevator, restaurant is right there...which is a HUGE blessing when you're in 6" inch heels quietly reminding yourself that your toes can handle the pain as long as you look good.  There is a cool pawn shop upon entering and everything is for sale...even some of the people walking in (I'll explain later).  Once you get through pawn shop the actual restaurant-  Atmosphere: Elegant, sexy, dimly lit with a fantastic DJ mixing our favorite jams from when Aquanet clouds were a thing. The vibe is intimate but don't expect to hear anything without yelling or reading lips as it's quite loud early on. It's really like a nightclub with good food.  Food & Drink: Good selection of craft cocktails, wine, and even virgin cocktails with names like "Garnet Gimlet" served in coupe gases that let you fit in with the other inbibers.  The menu is mostly tapas style options with a few entrees. Oysters with a frozen mignonette granita--refreshing. Beets & creamy Burata was good, served a top a shmear of beet puree. Tuna Poke Wonton Tacos - 2 bite crispy deliciousness. Tomato soup dumplings - surprisingly this filled us up. Nice bites of cheesey dumplings with crispy crumbs.  Homemade Cavatelli - Soo good. I was expecting something different when I see cavatelli with broccoli but this dish blew us away. My wife was the lucky one who ordered it. Perfect pasta in a light tomato sauce speckled with spicy Italian sausage and dots of ricotta to mix in. I am so getting this dish the next time.  Mexican Street Corn Ravioli - It's exactly how I would have made it. Elote & ravioli got married here surrounded by their saucy guests.  As I mentioned earlier, everything is for sale especially in Vegas, on the Strip as evidenced by a large group walking in as we were leaving, of buxom ladies in "uniform" minis held together with shoelaces accompanied by unremarkable, blue pill poppin, grey haired old men paying the night forward who will probably bring home a contagious souvenir. Hope the Beauty & MEH-Sex was worth it.

hy5dXmfZm4oe4raggXER4A.text: Not too impressed with the food, had the chicken pozole, pork chop, grilled cheese appetizer and artichoke on flatbread appetizer. It was ok, nothing great.  We had our 11 and 14 yr. old kids with us, we knew the restaurant wasn't for kids but the service towards us wasn't pleasant from the hostess to the waiter. They may as well put a sign up that says no children allowed if they're going to treat families differently. And no the kids weren't behaving badly, the table next to us even complimented us on their behavior. The setting is dark and seating comfortable. Took off 2 stars for the food and 1 star for the service. We'd be back if the food was great but not worth coming back for at all.

TotGuniG6_rE6POGFS9D0w.text: Just like the one in NYC, this location does not fail to disappoint. The "shareable" portions are tiny and very expensive......but it's Vegas baby! The cocktails didn't disappoint either.  Every single item that we ordered was a twist on a traditional entree. The presentation of all the items was very dramatic and the scene of the restaurant was amazing. I would highly recommend the tandoori chicken! It was the most opulent version of the dish that we ever tasted (all of us were indian) and I can't wait to have it again. What was even more amazing was that our server allowed us to completely skip the HUGE line for marquee! That was awesome was to end the meal and start our night. Thank you guys!

My09wkFWA_LRpbuAZr0P7Q.text: Years ago I visited the NY location and loved it. I'm glad they now have one in Vegas now.   Enter through a pawn shop, pass the bar and go into the beautiful dimly lit spacious restaurant. Loved the ambience and decor.   Service was slow sometimes. Took awhile to order and waited awhile to get our check. But the staffs were really friendly.   Ordered  Foie Gras Toast: skip. Can't really taste the foie Gras.   Fish n chip taco: good.   Tomato soup dumpling: my favorite.   French onion soup dumpling: good. Cute concept.   Mac n cheese: good  Sirloin: a bit too dry

azU61LrQiUn2b-4-t7HpiA.text: Overall it was a generally mediocre experience and definitely not worth a return visit.  We decided to try B&E out since numerous things on the menu looked interesting (if a bit disjointed with mexican, spanish, italian, and asian dishes interspersed).  Server explained about small plates, how much would be appropriate, etc, and we ended up ordering 7 things.  The pacing of the food was terrible.  Some dishes arrived within minutes of ordering (10 minutes faster than our wine), and all 7 arrived within a short period of time resulting in too much on the table at once and things going cold.  Small plates coming out randomly is not a new concept, but most kitchen pace things over a period of time to avoid the problems we ran into.  The various dining rooms are packed pretty tightly with tables, to the point where staff had difficulty moving between tables.  This may contribute to the noise level which many people comment on which is louder than expected.  Here's what we ended up getting: Tuna Poke Wonton Tacos - Decent flavor, but nothing that you haven't had at a dozen other places that serve this with the poke craze going on.  Yellowtail Sashimi - Probably the best dish of the evening.  Again something everyone has on the menu these days, but this had it's own standpoint with the flavored ponzu and the texture/flavor of the toppings on the fish.  Caesar toast - It's ceasar salad on toast topped with crumbled crispy chicken skin.  There's not enough chicken skin to provide a change in texture or flavor.  Roasted bone marrow - 3 half bones, well roasted, with salt and marmalade on the side if you want it.  The salt was key, but again the was nothing special about this if you've had roasted marrow before.  Tomato soup dumplings - Cheese tortellini sitting in tomato soup, very underwhelming.  Neither component had any particularly interesting flavor.  I thought for sure this was going to be some sort of xiao long bao presentation, which would have at least been a novel form.  Spanish braised octopus tacos - Good cook on the octopus, which is appreciated.  It's an interesting way to attempt and meld the traditional spanish octopus into a taco, but the beans didn't really add anything and the saffron made things taste "fishy" which took away from the octopus.  Croque Monsieur Mac & Cheese - Pretty boring mac and cheese.  I didn't understand what made it "croque monsieur" and definitely didn't taste the dijon.  The noodle to sauce ratio was also off resulting in too much noodle not having a good cheese sauce coating.  This was the last to arrive on an already full table and was lukewarm by the time we got to it. I do give kudos to the server who replaced it with a fresh one after we commented on that fact.

blBUBOuGX511SrcOKWBDSA.text: I've been here for food once, but the bar multiple times. It's one of my favorite venues in the Cosmopolitan. Great vibe. Excellent service. The bar is a great place to come for a post-dinner drink after you've been to any place on the property.

JLPKu4A2GxjJwxxk1ndWyA.text: My best friend held one of her birthday dinners here. I've been to the one in LA but this place was way better. I absolutely loved the food as I did in LA but the environment was different.

dNXAuVqgmlduTdtgRwFiGQ.text: Beauty & Essex is the sexiest restaurant in Vegas. Located inside the gorgeous Cosmopolitan hotel, it's hidden behind what appears to be a quiet jewelry shop. We gave the woman behind the counter our reservation name, and she led us to a side door which almost made us feel as if we were being taken back into a speakeasy.   Once inside, the atmosphere instantly changed and was a whirlwind of nightlife and energy. Lots of dark accents and soft lighting, beautiful people, stunning plates of food, and lounge music playing in the background. I loved that they had matches in a bowl by the hostess stand too, as it reminded me of all the ones I collected from fancy restaurants over the years when I was younger during special family occasion dinners.   It was easy to make a reservation through OpenTable, and the corner booth we were given was ideal for people watching during our meal. None of us were particularity starved, so our game plan was to order a bunch of smaller plates and share them tapas style. That way we could also each try a little bit of everything.   My friend and I each got a glass of wine while my husband ordered a beer, and we decided to first start with their dumplings since those were what I had heard so much about. The french onion soup ones came out first, and were presented in what appeared to be an escargot dish.  The dumplings were filled with an onion soup broth, and were at the bottom of a toothpick. When you lifted it up, a string of melty cheese would follow and you simply pop the whole thing in your mouth and pull the toothpick out. A crouton is at the end of each bite which gave a nice added texture. They were insane! Putting french onion soup into dumpling form was a downright genius idea.   I didn't think it was possible that I would love anything else that night as much as those, until the next dumplings came out which were grilled cheese and smoked bacon dumplings that sat on a spoonful of rich tomato soup. STOP IT. Actually don't, because I would like to eat about 89,000 more of those in my lifetime please.   We also ordered sweet and crispy Vidalia onion rings that came with a deliciously kicked up sambal ketchup, street style BBQ thai chicken with fresh picked carrots, mango, and a flavorful parsnip puree, and I believe french fries may have come into the equation at some point too, don't judge.   Each plate exceeded our expectations and kept our taste buds singing. I can't wait to make a return visit to try some of the dishes I didn't get to the first time around. In particular the bone marrow toast, chicken arepas, the short rib mac and cheese, elote scallops, strawberry shortcake bars, peanut butter pie sundae, and birthday cake shots.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup dumplings!
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Street Thai BBQ chicken w/lemongrass parsnip puree, pickled carrot, and mango
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Vidalia onion rings w/miso honey mustard and sambal ketchup

mbaCEm8vZAFHZ-7KnLeqVQ.text: What a very fun experience. The Ahi tacos were AH-mazing. The cocktail list made you want to try all of them and the service was impeccable. One thing I have to say...$50 corkage fee was really extreme and ridiculous.  They should really bring that fee WAY down because it made them look petty. Other than that, it was a fun and checked that off our list of restaurants to try. On to other restaurants that don't charge such an exorbitant corkage fee.

7snm2X9ZBBlSanCG_iKXFg.text: Really nice place. Make sure you make a reservation. They recommend that all dishes are for sharing.  Avocado toast for an appetizer was really good. We all shared the filet, scallops, lamb, crab legs.  Everything was really good. Cant go wrong. I would come back here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UglQXIMJq_mnQpBJwxvv-Q.text: At first, our service wasn't very good, but the manager on duty was so sweet and made it right instantly. He even threw in a couple free appetizers. This place was crowded, but the service was pretty quick. The food was spectacular.   For our apps: -Tomato Soup Dumplings (a special of the night) -Onion Rings - Jewels on Toast- Ceasar with Crispy Chicken Skin  They were both fantastic. The dumplings were absolutely incredible.  For our dinner:  -My mom got the filet- medium rare- cooked perfectly -I got the lamb chops- also cooked perfectly and the best chops I've ever had.   We shared a side of the Mac and Cheese. I'm not a huge fan of bacon or 'smokey' flavors, so it wasn't my favorite, but my mom loved it.   All-in-all the vibe was 100% what we were looking for. It was unique and quirky how when you walk in, it looks like a jewelry shop. We had a great experience and would be back next time we are in Vegas.   Expect to pay about $150-$200 for two people (before tip) if you're drinking.-

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jeweled Toast Ceasar style with crispy chicken skin. So yummy.
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese, smoked bacon, and tomato soup dumplings. Get them. Omg.
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect Lambchops--SO GOOD!

yZQIsgx7bhDdNVuUFMoYIw.text: Walking around on our third night in Vegas around 10pm decided we should probably eat dinner.   Being that it was Sunday many of the places I planned on were closed, but luckily beauty & Essex stays open til 12! Perfect.   Walked in without reservations. Looking super bummy compared to the other diners lol, it's a place you definitely want to dress up a bit.   Food:  Oysters - 4 stars. very good. Fresh tasting. I liked the flavor of the mignonette here, however the bf and I both thought it would be better if it wasn't frozen.   Bone marrow - 3 stars. I felt this could have been roasted more it wasn't that melt in your mouth texture I look for. I enjoyed the cilantro salad it came with as it added a much needed freshness between the rich marrow and hearty bread. Carmelized onions were also a nice addition I could have eaten those by themselves.   Sliders - 5 stars. Cooked to perfection, topping with pickled onion and tomato jam. the simple toppings were done so well they really didn't need anything more.   The service here was absolutely great even though we didn't fit the dress code haha.  We both really enjoyed this as our last meal in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry aged chuck sliders with tomato jam and pickled red onions
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted Bone Marrow on toast
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dozen oysters (mixed)

Jdl8p0QgCYtIgRGCxDRG6w.text: Go for the cool ambiance and be blown away by the food. Everything was exceptional! The service was a bit pretentious, however every dish we ordered met or exceeded our expectations. Highlights were the grilled cheese tomato bites, the scallops and lamb chops.

shYFP2KSrxstE9ZdbPgyKw.text: My husband and I enjoyed our awesome dinner here.  The atmosphere is dark and romantic.  The grilled cheese tomato soup dumplings are a MUST!!!!!! I could have ordered 5 of those.  So good.  We had the spaghettini as well and we both liked it.  The Broccolini was not our favorite.  I would say that is the only thing we did not finish.  I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Vegas.

NKrIY6kHRslHZtLostvaMw.text: The was my first time in the Las Vegas location. I've been to the Beauty & Essex in New York so I was curious to see if the quality was just as good and it sure was. From the service, the ambiance, and the food- everything was spectacular. The only difference is that the music was still really loud in the dining area so it was hard to have conversation without yelling across the table.   We ordered the tomato soup dumplings, the ahi tacos, the scallops, the steak, salmon, Mexican corn ravioli, their curry carrots, their bao mini sandwiches, and the meatballs...so technically the whole menu haha Jk. Everything was cooked and seasoned to perfection and with a party of 7, we were all stuffed considering the tapas style servings. Everything was divine but I did have my favorite dishes of the night...you can never go wrong with the tomato soup dumplings! It's like heaven in your mouth! The scallops were perfect and had a little spice to it! I love spicy but I didn't find it spicy at all versus my friend who has a more sensitive palate found it too much. Lastly, the salmon...I've never had salmon cooked the way they had it. It was moist and perfect and the couscous with the spinach complimented it perfectly. I honestly cannot wait to go back and eat there again!

Krwid6HYACg6s0b-64mzqg.text: We have been here twice, each time has been equally amazing. The first time we just sat in the bar area had all small plates and specialty cocktails. Everything we had was perfectly done has so much flavor and was just the right amount.   The second time we came here we wanted to actually sit in the dinning area, the place was pretty busy but we were seated right away. Right in front we had drinks of course specialty cocktails and we shared a few of the plates. Once again everything was so delicious and perfectly done.   This place is amazing and has excellent taste.

czKKMQEYInvQBW0il7FVJw.text: I went here last night for dinner and was disappointed in my experience. We got a reservation at 6:30 and they gave us a super small table. Half the restaurant was still empty and we requested to be seated at a larger table, but they never moved us.   We ordered the K-town Bao buns, Grilled cheese dumplings, scallops, ravioli, Thai shrimp and chicken meatballs. The grilled cheese dumplings came out kinda cold, the Bao buns were a little strange because it was like hamburger meat with Asian slaw, it threw me off since it was like a fusion between and American burger, but would be better off with pork belly inside. The ravioli was a little too rich for us. The sauce the put on the ravioli was pretty rock and the Mexican corn elote was too dry. The scallops were super salty and over cooked, that we had to return it. The chicken meatballs were too mushy for us. The only thing we really enjoyed were the Thai shrimp, which had a great batter and was deep fried. I enjoyed the papaya salad that came with it as well.   I really wanted to try some of their other dishes that I saw on yelp, but they change their menu seasonally which is a shame. I also wish they had their butter popcorn ice cream that I loved at their Los Angeles location.   Having been to the Beauty and Essex in New York and Los Angeles. I had high hopes for this Vegas location.   Overall, it's a cool spot to check out, but there are a lot of better restaurants to eat at the Cosmo.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ravioli with Elote. Super rich and the Elote was over cooked and dry
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai shrimp. This was my favorite dish
Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese dumplings came out cold, could of been a lot better if it was hot

piI7qiM5LZbeKHuNA5iXyg.text: I've stayed at the Cosmo a whole bunch of times, but I never really stopped by here, and that was probably one of my biggest regrets. The service was incredible, and the atmosphere at this place was amazing.   Also, everything we had ordered that night was perfect. If there's anything I recommend you get its the following: the empanadas, garganelli, sweet chilli scallops, and the mac and cheese. I got the shrimp cocktail as well, but I wouldn't go out of my way to order it.

j3JIvgbyDyTqZUjLThSjFg.text: Love that my favorite restaurant is conveniently located inside my favorite hotel. We were here last weekend and ate here both Friday night and Saturday night. Tomahawk one night and a filet the next. The grilled cheese tomato soup dumplings are always a must and the tuna poke wonton tacos are out of this world.

GvixWRkfeRJPQ1Bs4VikzA.text: Food was amazing but I was sad at the poor rye whiskey selection. Went with a few girlfriends and shared plates - everything was really good (umm especially the mac & cheese) and reasonably priced considering this is in the Cosmo.   I took off a star because my manhattan was not very good but I learned Vegas doesn't know how to make proper whiskey drinks anyways. It was only $50 per person for food (sans booze) which is a pretty damn good deal. Service was also on par. I shall be back! (and yes, it is behind a pawn shop - unfort the pawn shop had mostly costume jewelry).

AkIgMre5CmdfExNYvVfvWQ.text: The atmosphere is great, but I told my waiter I'm allergic to spice and asked if I could get the chili scallops without spice. He said he could put the jalapeno butter on the side. He obviously did not tell the kitchen I can't do spice because it came with jalapenos on the scallops!

zoG4hOZCt-eAMMiMSFyPCQ.text: 5 star restaurant, easily!! I came here with 3 other people, we had an AMAZING 5 course meal. Every item that was ordered was outstanding, special and unique. The staff was friendly, professional and prompt. The food was warm and fresh. They portions were plentiful. They even gave me a special birthday treat. After our fantastic meal, and perfect experience, this will be a place we always come back to when in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0XJbkaJdVjRz4IKq7Onfxw.text: Came for birthday dinner March 4th.  Was amazed and delighted, top to bottom.  They even sent some tasty cake pops to the table when done.  Get the tacos!  Amazing food, great menu, great place, great vibe, staff is ON POINT.

aaUUtzFcJvQkAhqj8pFrIg.text: A very cool place. Interior is very unique. Amazing chandlers and the overall design.   Food is very good. Presented in a somewhat unusual way but oh so very good :)

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States

45LOJkuonoo-aR_JoDJGQg.text: Beautiful ambience behind a pawn shop in the Cosmopolitan. The Beauty and Essex burger (short rib, lamb, brisket) was one of the best burgers of my life.  Docked one star for overpriced drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Beauty & Essex - Las Vegas, NV, United States
